pastry.eg: We were offered a selection of cakes and pastries with our tea.

pat.eng_def: to touch someone or something gently and usually repeatedly with the hand flat
pat.eg: He patted my head/patted me on the head affectionately.

pat.eng_def: the act of patting a person or animal
pat.eg: I gave the little boy a pat on the head.

pat.eng_def: a small flat piece, especially of butter
A pat answer or remark has been previously prepared, so that it is said quickly and without any real thought.
pat.chi_def: （回答或說話）預先準備好的，脫口而出的
pat.eg: The spokesman came out with a pat answer/response.

patch.eng_def: a small area that is different in some way from the area that surrounds it
patch.eg: Our dog has a black patch on his back.

patch.eng_def: a local area within which someone works
patch.eg: He's been working as a policeman on the same patch for 20 years.

patch.eng_def: a small piece of material sewn or stuck over something to cover it
patch.eg: I'll have to sew a patch onto these jeans - they're ripped at the knee.

patch.eng_def: a small piece of material that can be stuck to the skin, from which particular substances can be absorbed into the body
patch.eg: Some people wear nicotine patches to help them give up smoking.

patch.eng_def: a small computer program that can be added to an existing program in order to make the existing program work as it should
patch.chi_def: （用來完善已有程式的）程式補釘，修補程式
patch.eg: I downloaded a patch from their website.

patch.eng_def: to connect electronic or phone equipment to a system
patch.chi_def: 接通，連接（電子設備或電話）

patch.eng_def: to put a patch on something

patent.eng_def: the official legal right to make or sell an invention for a particular number of years
patent.eg: In 1880 Alexander Graham Bell was granted a patent on an apparatus for signalling and communicating called a Photophone.

patent.eng_def: to get the official legal right to make or sell an invention
patent.eg: If you don't patent your invention, other people may make all the profit out of it.

patent.eng_def: A patent invention is protected by law so that only particular people or companies have the right to make or sell it.

path.eng_def: a route or track between one place and another, or the direction in which something is moving
a set of actions, especially ones that lead to a goal or result
path.chi_def: （尤指達到某一目的或結果的）行動步驟，途徑
path.eg: The path to success is fraught with difficulties.

pathetic.eng_def: causing feelings of sadness, sympathy, or sometimes lack of respect, especially because a person or an animal is suffering
pathetic.eg: The refugees were a pathetic sight - starving, frightened and cold.

pathetic.eng_def: unsuccessful or showing no ability, effort, or bravery, so that people feel no respect

patience.eng_def: the ability to wait, or to continue doing something despite difficulties, or to suffer without complaining or becoming annoyed
patience.eg: You have to have such a lot of patience when you're dealing with kids.

patience.eng_def: a game played with cards by one person

patient.eng_def: a person who is receiving medical care, or who is cared for by a particular doctor or dentist when necessary
patient.eg: I'm a patient of Dr Stephens; please could I make an appointment to see her?
Dinner will be ready in half an hour - just be patient!

patriot.eng_def: a person who loves their country and, if necessary, will fight for it

patriotic.eng_def: showing love for your country and being proud of it

patrol.eng_def: (especially of soldiers or the police) to go around an area or a building to see if there is any trouble or danger
patrol.eg: The whole town is patrolled by police because of the possibility of riots.

patrol.eng_def: the act of checking that there is no trouble or danger in a building or area
a small group of soldiers or military ships, aircraft, or vehicles, especially one that patrols an area
patrol.chi_def: 巡邏兵，巡邏隊；巡邏艇；巡邏機；巡邏車
patrol.eg: Our forward patrol has/have spotted the enemy.

patron.eng_def: a person or group that supports an activity or organization, especially by giving money
patron.eg: The Princess Royal is a well-known patron of several charities.

patron.eng_def: a person who uses a particular shop, restaurant, hotel, etc., especially regularly
patron.eg: Will patrons kindly note that this restaurant will be closed on 17 July .

pattern.eng_def: a particular way in which something is done, is organized, or happens
pattern.eg: The pattern of family life has been changing over recent years.

pattern.eng_def: any regularly repeated arrangement, especially a design made from repeated lines, shapes, or colours on a surface
pattern.eg: Look, the frost has made a beautiful pattern on the window.

pattern.eng_def: something that is used as an example, especially to copy
pattern.eg: The design is so good it's sure to set the pattern for many others.

pattern.eng_def: a drawing or shape used to show how to make something
a small piece of cloth or paper taken from a usual-sized piece and used to show what it looks like

pause.eng_def: a short period in which something such as a sound or an activity is stopped before starting again
pause.eg: There will be a brief pause in the proceedings while the piano is moved into place.

pause.eng_def: a button or control that allows you to stop a recording for a short time
pause.eg: I pressed pause/the pause button so I could go make a cup of tea.

pause.eng_def: a period of silence between musical notes, or a symbol that represents this
a symbol in music meaning that a note or rest should be held for longer than normal
to stop doing something for a short time
pause.eg: He paused and thought for a moment.

pause.eng_def: to make a recording stop for a short time by pressing a button
pause.eg: Can you pause the movie there, please?

pave.eng_def: to cover an area of ground with a hard, flat surface of pieces of stone, concrete, or bricks
pave.eg: The area near the beach is paved with bricks set in patterns.

pavement.eng_def: a path with a hard surface on one or both sides of a road, that people walk on
pavement.eg: Keep to the pavement, Rosie, there's a good girl.

pavement.eng_def: the surface of a road when it has been covered with concrete or tarmac

paw.eng_def: the foot of an animal that has claws or nails, such as a cat, dog, or bear
paw.eg: I found paw prints in the kitchen.
Take your filthy paws off my nice clean towel!

paw.eng_def: to touch something with a paw
paw.eg: When their dog heard them it began pawing (at) the ground in excitement.

paw.eng_def: to feel or touch someone roughly with the hands, especially in an unpleasant sexual way
paw.chi_def: 摸弄，抓捏；（尤指）猥褻地動手動腳

pay.eng_def: to give money to someone for something you want to buy or for services provided
pay.eg: How much did you pay for the tickets?

pay.eng_def: If something pays for itself, it works so well that it saves the same amount of money that it cost.
pay.eg: The advertising should pay for itself.

pay.eng_def: to give money to someone for work that they have done
pay.eg: The company pays its interns $4,000 a month.

pay.eng_def: to give a profit or advantage to someone or something
pay.chi_def: 有收益，有利可圖，有好處
pay.eg: It never pays to take risks where human safety is concerned.
The commander paid tribute to the courage of his troops.

pay.eng_def: to watch, listen to, or think about something carefully
pay.chi_def: （通過仔細看、聽或思考）關注（某事）
pay.eg: You weren't paying attention to what I was saying.

pay.eng_def: to visit a person or place, usually for a short time
pay.eg: I'll pay you a call when I'm in the area.

pay.eng_def: the money you receive for doing a job
pay.eg: It's a nice job but the pay is appalling.

pay.eng_def: to work for someone, especially secretly

payment.eg: Usually we ask for payment on receipt of the goods.
Verbal abuse was hardly the payment I expected for my troubles.

payment.eng_def: an amount of money received by an employee because of a pay rise at an earlier time
payment.chi_def: （因早些時候漲工資而得到的）補發工資

pea.eng_def: a round, green seed, several of which grow in a pod, eaten as a vegetable

peace.eng_def: freedom from war and violence, especially when people live and work together happily without disagreements
the state of not being interrupted or annoyed by worry, problems, noise, or unwanted actions
peace.eg: You'll need peace and quiet to study.

peach.eng_def: a round fruit with sweet yellow flesh that has a lot of juice, a slightly furry red and yellow skin, and a large seed in its centre
peach.eg: Would you like peaches and cream for dessert?

peach.eng_def: someone or something that is excellent or very pleasing
peach.chi_def: 傑出的人；極好的東西；特別討人喜歡的人（或物）
peach.eg: He's a real peach of a guy.

peach.eng_def: a pale colour between pink and orange
having a pale colour between pink and orange

peacock.eng_def: a large bird, the male of which has very long tail feathers that it can spread out to show bright colours and patterns shaped like eyes
a man is who is very proud of his appearance and gives a lot of attention to his clothes and the way he dresses
peacock.chi_def: 注重儀表和衣飾的男子，虛榮驕傲的男子

peak.eng_def: the highest, strongest, or best point, value, or level of skill
peak.eg: Prices reach a peak during August.

peak.eng_def: the pointed top of a mountain, or the mountain itself
peak.eg: It is one of the most difficult peaks to climb.

peak.eng_def: the flat curved part of a cap that goes above the eyes of the person who is wearing it
Peak times are the times when most people are using or doing something.
peak.eg: Traffic congestion is really bad at peak periods (= when it is busiest).

peak.eng_def: Peak levels or rates are when they are at their highest.
to reach the highest, strongest, or best point, value, or level of skill
peak.eg: Official figures show that unemployment peaked in November.

peanut.eng_def: an oval-shaped nut that grows underground in pairs inside a thin brown shell
something so small it is not worth considering, especially an amount of money
peanut.chi_def: 無甚價值之物；（尤指）一小筆錢
peanut.eg: They pay people peanuts in that organization.

pear.eng_def: a sweet fruit, usually with a green skin and a lot of juice, that has a round base and is slightly pointed towards the stem

pearl.eng_def: a small, round object, usually white, that forms around a grain of sand inside the shell of a sea creature, especially an oyster. Pearls are valuable and are used to make jewellery.

pearl.eg: He gave her pearls for her birthday.
There were pearls of dew on the grass.

pearl.eng_def: the white shiny colour of pearl or a pale colour

peasant.eng_def: a person who owns or rents a small piece of land and grows crops, keeps animals, etc. on it, especially one who has a low income, very little education, and a low social position. This is usually used of someone who lived in the past or of someone in a poor country.
peasant.chi_def: （通常指舊時或貧窮國家的）農民，農夫
peasant.eg: Tons of internationally donated food was distributed to the starving peasants.

peasant.eng_def: a person who is not well educated or is rude and does not behave well

pebble.eng_def: a small smooth round stone, especially one found on a beach or in a river
pebble.chi_def: （尤指沙灘或河流中的）卵石，礫石
pebble.eg: This part of the coast has pebble beaches.

peck.eng_def: When a bird pecks, it bites, hits, or picks up something small with its beak.
peck.eg: The birds learn to peck holes in the milk bottle tops.

peck.eng_def: to give someone a quick kiss, especially on the side of the face
peck.eg: He pecked his aunt on the cheek.
She gave me the usual peck on the cheek.

peculiar.eng_def: unusual and strange, sometimes in an unpleasant way
peculiar.eg: She has the most peculiar ideas.

peculiar.eng_def: belonging to, relating to, or found in only particular people or things
peculiar.eg: He gets on with things in his own peculiar way/manner/fashion.

pedal.eng_def: a small part of a machine or object that is pushed down with the foot to operate or move the machine or object
operated by a pedal or pedals
to push the pedals of a bicycle with your feet
pedal.eg: He struggled to pedal his bicycle up the hill.

peddle.eng_def: to sell things, especially by taking them to different places
peddle.eg: These products are generally peddled (from) door to door.

peddle.eng_def: If you peddle stories or information, you spread them by telling different people.
peddle.eg: The organization has peddled the myth that they are supporting the local population.

peddler.eng_def: especially in the past, a person who travelled to different places to sell small goods, usually by going from house to house
someone who gives ideas to other people
peddler.eg: a peddler of New Age philosophies

peddler.eng_def: someone who sells illegal drugs to people

pedestrian.eng_def: a person who is walking, especially in an area where vehicles go
pedestrian.eg: A few pedestrians sheltered from the rain in doorways.

pedestrian.eng_def: not interesting; showing very little imagination
pedestrian.chi_def: 乏味的，單調的；缺乏想像力的
pedestrian.eg: Her books, with few exceptions, are workmanlike but pedestrian.

peek.eng_def: to look, especially for a short time or while trying to avoid being seen
peek.eg: Close your eyes. Don't peek. I've got a surprise for you.

peek.eng_def: to stick out slightly and be partly seen
peek.eg: I could just see her petticoat peeking out from under her skirt.

peek.eng_def: to look at something for a short time
peek.eg: If I'm passing by I might take a peek at the new premises.

peel.eng_def: to remove the skin of fruit and vegetables
peel.chi_def: 除去，剝去（水果、蔬菜的）皮
peel.eg: Peel, core, and chop the apples.

peel.eng_def: If a layer or covering peels, it slowly comes off, and if you peel a layer or covering, you remove it slowly and carefully.
peel.chi_def: （表層）脫落，剝落；剝去（表層），剝去…的殼
peel.eg: We peeled the wallpaper off the walls.

peel.eng_def: If you peel, or part of your body or your skin peels, parts of the top layer of your skin comes off because you are burned from being in the sun.
the skin of fruit and vegetables, especially after it has been removed
peel.chi_def: （尤指水果和蔬菜被削掉的）外皮

peep.eng_def: to secretly look at something for a short time, usually through a hole
peep.eg: I saw her peeping through the curtains/into the room.

peep.eng_def: to appear slowly and not be completely seen
peep.eg: A few early flowers had peeped up through the snow.

peep.eng_def: to make a weak high noise
peep.chi_def: 唧唧叫，發出尖而弱的聲音

peep.eg: No one has raised a peep about this dreadful behaviour.

peep.eng_def: the weak high noise made by young birds

peep.eg: Take/Have a peep at what it says in this letter.

peer.eng_def: to look carefully or with difficulty
peer.eg: When no one answered the door, she peered through the window to see if anyone was there.

peer.eng_def: a person who is the same age or has the same social position or the same abilities as other people in a group
peer.chi_def: 同齡人；同輩；同儕；同等社會地位（或能力）的人
peer.eg: Do you think it's true that teenage girls are less self-confident than their male peers?

peer.eng_def: in the UK, a person who has a high social position and any of a range of titles, including baron, earl, and duke, or a life peer

peg.eng_def: a small stick or hook that sticks out from a surface and from which objects, especially clothes, can hang
peg.chi_def: 小釘；掛物釘；（尤指）掛衣鉤
peg.eg: He took off his coat/hat and hung it on the peg.

peg.eng_def: a reason for discussing something further
peg.chi_def: （進一步討論某事物的）依據，理由
peg.eg: They decided to use the anniversary as the peg for/a peg on which to hang a TV documentary.

peg.eng_def: a device used to fasten something into a particular place
peg.eg: Hammer the (tent) pegs firmly into the ground.

peg.eng_def: a low fast throw in baseball
an arrangement that fixes a price, currency, etc. at a particular level
peg.chi_def: （固定價格、貨幣等的安排）掛鉤
peg.eg: The government removed the currency from its peg against the dollar.

peg.eng_def: to fasten something in place with pegs
peg.eg: Make sure the tarpaulin is securely pegged down.

peg.eng_def: to make a price, currency, etc. stay at a particular level
peg.chi_def: 把…固定在某一水準；限定，限制
peg.eg: The agreement works because member nations haven't tried to peg prices.

peg.eng_def: to throw a ball in baseball low and fast
peg.eg: Mattingly pegged the ball to Stanley.

pen.eng_def: a long, thin object used for writing or drawing with ink
a small area surrounded by a fence, especially one in which animals are kept

pen.eg: He served nine years in the state pen.
She penned a note of thanks to her hostess.

penalty.eng_def: a punishment, or the usual punishment, for doing something that is against a law
penalty.eg: The law carries a penalty of up to three years in prison.

penalty.eng_def: a type of punishment, often involving paying money, that is given to you if you break an agreement or do not follow rules
penalty.eg: Currently, ticket holders pay a penalty equal to 25 percent of the ticket price when they change their flight plans.

penalty.eng_def: an advantage given in some sports to a team or player when the opposing team or player breaks a rule
penalty.chi_def: （體育運動中對犯規者的）判罰，處罰
penalty.eg: The referee awarded (= gave) a penalty kick.

penalty.eng_def: a disadvantage brought about as a result of a situation or action
penalty.chi_def: （某情況或行動帶來的）不利，劣勢
penalty.eg: Loss of privacy is one of the penalties of success.

pencil.eng_def: a long, thin object, usually made of wood, for writing or drawing, with a sharp black or coloured point at one end
the form of some types of make-up

pencil.eg: A pencil of light showed as the door opened slightly.

pencil.eng_def: used to describe something that has been drawn with a pencil
to write something with a pencil

penetrate.eng_def: to move into or through something
penetrate.eg: Amazingly, the bullet did not penetrate his brain.

penetrate.eng_def: to succeed in becoming part of an organization, etc. and working within it
penetrate.chi_def: 成功進入（機構）成為其一部分
penetrate.eg: The organization had been penetrated by a spy.
These changes had not yet penetrated as far west as the mountains of Merioneth.

penetrate.eng_def: If your eyes penetrate somewhere dark, you manage to see through it.
penetrate.eg: Our eyes couldn't penetrate the dark/the gloom of the inner cave.

penetrate.eng_def: When a man penetrates his partner during sex, he puts his penis into his or her body.
to study or investigate something in order to understand it
penetrate.eg: It's hard to penetrate her mind.

penguin.eng_def: a black and white bird that cannot fly but uses its small wings to help it swim

peninsula.eng_def: a long piece of land that sticks out from a larger area of land into the sea or into a lake

penny.eng_def: the smallest unit of money in the UK, of which there are 100 in a pound, or a small coin worth this much. You use "pence" or, more informally, "p" when you are talking about the units of money and pennies when you are talking about the coins themselves.
penny.chi_def: （英國）便士（最小的貨幣單位，100便士為1英鎊，表示幣值時用 pence 或在非正式場合也可用 p，而表示硬幣本身時用 pennies）
penny.eg: Could you lend me 50 pence/50p please?

penny.eng_def: in the US and Canada, a cent or a coin of this value
in the UK before 1971, a large coin. There were twelve pennies in a shilling.
penny.chi_def: 便士（英國在1971年以前使用的大硬幣，12便士等於1先令）

penny.eng_def: used when talking about the smallest amount of money possible
penny.eg: Buy a TV now and it won't cost you a penny (= will cost nothing) for three months.

penny.eng_def: used in the past with numbers to show how many pence something cost

pension.eng_def: an amount of money paid regularly by the government or a private company to a person who does not work any more because they are too old or have become ill

people.eg: Many people never do any exercise.

people.eng_def: used to refer to everyone, or informally to the group that you are speaking to
people.eg: People will think you've gone mad.

people.eng_def: men and women who are involved in a particular type of work
people.eg: We'll have to get the people at the city council to look at these plans.

people.eng_def: the large number of ordinary men and women who do not have positions of power in society
people.eg: She claims to be the voice of the people.

people.eng_def: the people someone is related to
people.eg: Her people come from Scotland originally.

people.eng_def: all the men, women, and children who live in a particular country, or who have the same culture or language
people.eg: The French are known as a food-loving people.
Customs similar to this one are found among many peoples of the world.

pepper.eng_def: a grey or white powder produced by crushing dry peppercorns, used to give a spicy, hot taste to food
a vegetable that is usually green, red, or yellow, has a rounded shape, and is hollow with seeds in the middle

per.eng_def: used when expressing rates, prices, or measurements to mean "for each"
per.eg: The meal will cost $20 per person.

perceive.eng_def: to come to an opinion about something, or have a belief about something
perceive.eg: How do the French perceive the British?

perceive.eng_def: to see something or someone, or to notice something that is obvious
perceive.eg: Bill perceived a tiny figure in the distance.

percent.eng_def: for or out of every 100, shown by the symbol %
percent.eg: You got 20 percent of the answers right - that means one in every five.

percentage.eng_def: an amount of something, often expressed as a number out of 100
percentage.eg: What percentage of women return to work after having a baby?
There's no percentage in working such long hours.

perception.eng_def: a belief or opinion, often held by many people and based on how things seem
perception.eg: We have to change the public's perception that money is being wasted.

perception.eng_def: the quality of being aware of things through the physical senses, especially sight
perception.eg: Drugs can alter your perception of reality.

perception.eng_def: someone's ability to notice and understand things that are not obvious to other people
perception.chi_def: 感知能力；認識能力；洞察力
perception.eg: She has extraordinary powers of perception for one so young.

perch.eng_def: to sit on or near the edge of something
perch.chi_def: 坐在…（的邊緣）上；棲息於；停留於
perch.eg: We perched on bar stools and had a beer.

perch.eng_def: to be in a high position or in a position near the edge of something, or to put something in this position
perch.chi_def: （使）位於高處（或…的邊緣）；（使）棲息在高處（或…的邊緣）
perch.eg: The village is perched on top of a high hill.

perch.eng_def: a fish that lives in lakes and rivers and is eaten as food
a place where a bird sits, especially a thin rod in a cage (= wire box)
perch.chi_def: （鳥的）棲息處（尤指鳥籠裡的棲木）

perch.eng_def: a seat or other place high up, often giving a good view of something below
perch.chi_def: （常指能很好地俯視低處的）高座，高處
perch.eg: We watched the parade from our perch on the scaffolding.

perfect.eng_def: complete and correct in every way, of the best possible type or without fault

perfect.chi_def: （用於強調名詞）十足的，百分百的，完全的，絕對的

perfect.eng_def: exactly right for someone or something
perfect.chi_def: （對某人或某物）最恰當的，完美的
perfect.eg: You'd be perfect for the job.

perfect.eng_def: of or relating to a verb indicating a completed action
the tense of a verb that shows action that has happened in the past or before another time or event
perfect.eg: In English, the perfect is formed with "have" and the past participle of the verb.

perfect.eng_def: to make something free from faults
perfect.eg: He is keen to perfect his golfing technique.

perfection.eng_def: the state of being complete and correct in every way
perfection.eg: In his quest for physical perfection, he spends hours in the gym.
The fish was cooked to perfection.

perform.eng_def: to do an action or piece of work
perform.eg: Computers can perform a variety of tasks.

perform.eng_def: to operate/not operate in a satisfactory way
perform.eg: The equipment performed well during the tests.

perform.eng_def: to entertain people by dancing, singing, acting, or playing music
perform.eg: Thomas and Elisa performed a rousing duet for violin and piano.

performance.eng_def: how well a person, machine, etc. does a piece of work or an activity
performance.chi_def: 工作情況；業績；表現；工作性能
performance.eg: He was an experienced player who was always seeking to improve his performance.

performance.eng_def: the action of entertaining other people by dancing, singing, acting, or playing music
performance.eg: a performance of Arthur Miller's play "The Crucible"

performance.eng_def: an action or type of behaviour that involves a lot of attention to detail or to small matters that are not important
performance.eg: Cleaning the oven is such a performance.

performance.eng_def: an occasion when an event or a situation happens again
performance.eg: The police hope to avoid a repeat performance of last year, when the festivities turned into rioting.

performer.eng_def: a person who entertains people by acting, singing, dancing, or playing music
If you are a particular type of performer, you are able to do the stated thing well or badly.
performer.eg: The British boat was the star performer in the race.

perfume.eng_def: a liquid with a pleasant smell, usually made from oils taken from flowers or spices and often used on the skin

perfume.eg: The perfume of the roses filled the room.

perhaps.eng_def: used to show that something is possible or that you are not certain about something
perhaps.eg: He hasn't written to me recently - perhaps he's lost my address.

perhaps.eng_def: used to show that a number or amount is approximate
perhaps.eg: There were perhaps 500 people at the meeting.

perhaps.eng_def: used when making polite requests or statements of opinion
perhaps.chi_def: （用於禮貌地要求或陳述意見）或許，也許
perhaps.eg: "I never remember people's birthdays." "Well, perhaps you should."

peril.eng_def: great danger, or something that is very dangerous
peril.eg: I never felt that my life was in peril.

peril.eng_def: to do something that might be very dangerous for you
peril.eg: We underestimate the destructiveness of war at our peril.

period.eg: Her work means that she spends long periods away from home.

period.eng_def: in school, a division of time in the day when a subject is taught
period.eg: We have six periods of science a week.

period.eng_def: a fixed time during the life of a person or in history
period.chi_def: （人一生中或歷史上的）時期；階段
period.eg: Most teenagers go through a rebellious period.

period.eng_def: the bleeding from a woman's womb that happens once a month when she is not pregnant
the symbol . used in writing at the end of a sentence or at the end of the short form of a word
said at the end of a statement to show that you believe you have said all there is to say on a subject and you are not going to discuss it any more
period.chi_def: （用於一句話的結尾，表示某一話題已討論完畢，不願再繼續）到此為止，就這樣
period.eg: There will be no more shouting, period!

period.eng_def: the clothes or furniture of a particular time in history
period.chi_def: 某個歷史時期的服飾／服裝／傢俱
period.eg: They performed "Julius Caesar" in period dress.

perish.eng_def: to die, especially in an accident or by being killed, or to be destroyed
perish.chi_def: （尤指因意外或遇害）喪生，死亡；湮滅；毀滅
perish.eg: Three hundred people perished in the earthquake.

perish.eng_def: If material such as rubber or leather perishes, it decays and starts to break into pieces.
perish.eg: Sunlight has caused the rubber to perish.

permanent.eng_def: lasting for a long time or for ever
permanent.eg: She is looking for a permanent place to stay.

permanent.eng_def: Something that is permanent exists or happens all the time.
permanent.eg: Mont Blanc has a permanent snow cap.

permanent.eng_def: a chemical process that makes your hair curly, or a hairstyle that is created in this way

permissible.eg: Is it permissible to park my car here?

permission.eng_def: If someone is given permission to do something, they are allowed to do it.
permission.eg: You will need permission from your parents to go on the trip.

permit.eg: The regulations do not permit much flexibility.
The Chancellor is looking to lower interest rates, when economic conditions permit.

permit.eng_def: an official document that allows you to do something or go somewhere

perseverance.eg: Through hard work and perseverance, he worked his way up to the top.

persevere.eng_def: to try to do or continue doing something in a determined way, despite having problems
persevere.eg: It looks as if the policy will be a success, providing that the government perseveres and does not give in to its critics.

persist.eng_def: If an unpleasant feeling or situation persists, it continues to exist.
persist.eg: If the pain persists, consult a doctor.

persist.eng_def: to try to do or continue doing something in a determined but often unreasonable way
persist.eg: If he persists in asking awkward questions, then send him to the boss.

persistence.eng_def: the fact that someone or something persists
persistence.chi_def: 持續存在；堅持不懈，執意
persistence.eg: Most financial analysts have been surprised by the persistence of the recession.

persistent.eng_def: lasting for a long time or difficult to get rid of
persistent.chi_def: 持續的；存留的；頑強存在的

persistent.eng_def: Someone who is persistent continues doing something or tries to do something in a determined but often unreasonable way.

person.eg: Who was the first person to swim the English Channel?

person.chi_def: （用於描述人的某一品質）…的人

person.eng_def: If you do something or go somewhere in person, you do it or go there yourself.
person.eg: If you can't be there in person, the next best thing is watching it on TV.

person.eng_def: used in grammar to describe the verbs and pronouns that refer to the different people in a conversation. The first person ("I" or "we") refers to the person speaking, the second person ("you") refers to the person being spoken to and the third person ("he", "she", "it", or "they") refers to another person or thing being spoken about or described
person.chi_def: 人稱（第一人稱 I 或 we 指說話人，第二人稱 you 指聽話的人，第三人稱 he， she， it 或 they 指談到的人或事物）
person.eg: The novel is written in the first person, so that the author and narrator seem to be the same.

person.eng_def: used to combine with nouns to form new nouns referring to the particular job or duty that someone has. It is often used instead of -man or -woman to avoid making an unnecessary statement about the sex of the particular person
person.chi_def: 從事（某項工作）的人（常用來代替以 -man 和 -woman 結尾的名詞，以避免不必要提及性別）

personal.eng_def: relating or belonging to a single or particular person rather than to a group or an organization
personal.eg: My personal opinion/view is that the students should be doing more work outside the classroom.

personal.eng_def: A personal action is one that is done by someone directly rather than getting another person to do it.
personal.chi_def: 親自的，本人直接從事的
personal.eg: The mayor made a personal appearance at the hospital.

personal.eng_def: private or relating to someone's private life
personal.eg: The letter was marked "Personal. Strictly confidential."

personal.eng_def: relating to your body or appearance
personal.eg: She is obsessed with personal hygiene.

personal.eng_def: an intentionally offensive remark about someone's character or appearance
personal.chi_def: 人身攻擊；針對個人的評論
personal.eg: Did you have to make such a personal remark about her new haircut?

personal.eng_def: to start being rude to someone about their character or appearance
personal.eg: As long as the criticism is honestly given and doesn't get personal, I can handle it.

personal.eng_def: the part of a newspaper or magazine that contains short advertisements and private messages
personal.chi_def: （報紙或雜誌的）分類廣告欄目

personality.eng_def: the type of person you are, shown by the way you behave, feel, and think
personality.eg: She has a very warm personality.
The show is hosted by a popular TV personality.

personnel.eng_def: the people who are employed in a company, organization, or one of the armed forces
personnel.chi_def: （公司、組織或軍隊的）全體人員，員工，職員
personnel.eg: The new director is likely to make major changes in personnel.

personnel.eng_def: the department of a company or organization that deals with its employees when they first join, when they need training, or when they have any problems
personnel.eg: Personnel will help you find somewhere to live.

perspective.eng_def: a particular way of considering something
perspective.eg: Her attitude lends a fresh perspective to the subject.

perspective.eng_def: to think about a situation or problem in a wise and reasonable way
perspective.chi_def: 恰當地估計；合理地評價；正確地看待
perspective.eg: You must keep things in perspective - the overall situation isn't really that bad.

perspective.eng_def: to compare something to other things so that it can be accurately and fairly judged
perspective.chi_def: 客觀地比較；客觀地審查
perspective.eg: Total investments for this year reached $53 million, and, to put this into perspective, investments this year were double those made in 2013.

perspective.eng_def: the way that objects appear smaller when they are further away and the way parallel lines appear to meet each other at a point in the distance
perspective.eg: In 15th-century Italy, artists rediscovered the rules of perspective.

perspective.eng_def: An object or person that is in perspective has the correct size and position in comparison with other things in the picture.
perspective.chi_def: 透視比例正確的；有透視效果的

perspective.eng_def: An object or person that is out of perspective does not have the correct size or position in comparison with other things in the picture, and therefore does not look real or natural.
perspective.chi_def: 透視尺度失真的；比例（或位置）不當的

persuade.eng_def: to make someone do or believe something by giving them a good reason to do it or by talking to that person and making them believe it
persuade.eg: If she doesn't want to go, nothing you can say will persuade her.

persuasion.eng_def: the action of persuading someone or of being persuaded
persuasion.eg: It took a lot of persuasion to convince the committee of the advantages of the new plan.

persuasion.eng_def: a particular set of beliefs, especially religious ones
persuasion.eg: We need a society which welcomes people of all religious persuasions.

persuasive.eng_def: making you want to do or believe a particular thing
persuasive.chi_def: 有說服力的，令人信服的

pessimism.eng_def: emphasizing or thinking of the bad part of a situation rather than the good part, or the feeling that bad things are more likely to happen than good things
pessimism.eg: There is now a mood of deepening pessimism about/over the economy.

pessimistic.eng_def: thinking that bad things are more likely to happen or emphasizing the bad part of a situation
pessimistic.eg: The tone of the meeting was very pessimistic.

pest.eng_def: an insect or small animal that is harmful or damages crops
pest.chi_def: （破壞農作物的）有害小動物（或昆蟲）；害蟲
pest.eg: common pests such as rats, mice, or cockroaches

pest.eng_def: an annoying person, especially a child
pest.chi_def: 討厭的人；（尤指孩子）討厭鬼
pest.eg: Put that back, you little pest!

pesticide.eng_def: a chemical substance used to kill harmful insects, small animals, wild plants, and other unwanted organisms
pesticide.eg: The pesticides that farmers spray on their crops kill pests, but they can also damage people's health.

pet.eng_def: an animal that is kept in the home as a companion and treated kindly
pet.eg: They have several pets - a dog, two rabbits, and a guinea pig.

pet.eng_def: to be the person that someone in authority likes best and treats better than anyone else
pet.eg: The other children hated her because she was the teacher's pet.

pet.eng_def: a kind person who is easy to like
pet.eg: He's always sending me flowers - he's a real pet!

pet.eng_def: a friendly way of talking to someone, especially a woman or a child
pet.chi_def: 寶貝，乖乖（尤用於稱呼女性或孩子）

pet.eng_def: If you pet an animal, child, etc., you touch it, him, or her gently and kindly with your hands.
pet.eg: Our dog loves to be petted and tickled behind the ears.

pet.eng_def: If two people are petting, they are kissing and touching each other in a sexual way.
a theory, subject, hate, etc. that is special and important to you
pet.chi_def: 特別喜愛的理論／話題／特別討厭的事物（等等）
pet.eg: Football is one of her pet hates.

pet.eng_def: abbreviation for polyethylene terephthalate: a type of plastic used especially to make bottles
pet.chi_def: 聚對苯二甲酸乙二酯（polyethylene terephthalate 的縮寫）
pet.eg: The house has translucent walls made from a plastic called PET, essentially the same material used in soda bottles.

pet.eng_def: abbreviation for positron emission tomography: a method of using special rays (= beams of light) to make images of the inside of the body, especially the brain
pet.chi_def: 正電子發射斷層攝影術（positron emission tomography 的縮寫）
pet.eg: They used PET, a brain-scanning technology.

petal.eng_def: any of the usually brightly coloured parts that together form most of a flower
a friendly way of talking to someone, especially a woman or child
petal.chi_def: 寶貝，乖乖（尤用於稱呼女性或孩子）

petroleum.eng_def: a dark, thick oil obtained from under the ground, from which various substances including petrol, paraffin, and diesel oil are produced

petty.eng_def: not important and not worth giving attention to
petty.eg: Prisoners complain that they are subjected to too many petty rules and restrictions.

petty.eng_def: complaining too much about things that are not important
petty.chi_def: 過於注重瑣事的；小心眼的，心胸狹窄的

pharmacist.eng_def: a person who is trained to prepare and give out medicines in a hospital or shop

pharmacy.eng_def: a shop or part of a shop in which medicines are prepared and sold
pharmacy.chi_def: 藥店，藥房；（商店的）藥品部

pharmacy.eng_def: part of a hospital where medicines are prepared
the activity or study of medicine preparation

phase.eng_def: any stage in a series of events or in a process of development
phase.eg: The project is only in its initial phase as yet, but it's looking quite promising.

phase.eng_def: a period of strange or difficult behaviour that will stop after a while, especially a period that a young child or person goes through
phase.chi_def: 時期（尤指孩童或成人經歷的一段行為怪異或讓人費解的時期）
phase.eg: When I was in my early teens I went through a phase of only ever wearing black.

phase.eng_def: The phases of the moon are the regular changes in its shape as it appears to us on earth.
to introduce something in stages over a particular period of time
phase.eg: The reduction in armed forces will be phased over the next ten years.

phenomenon.eng_def: something that exists and can be seen, felt, tasted, etc., especially something unusual or interesting
phenomenon.chi_def: （尤指不尋常的或有趣的）現象

phenomenon.eng_def: someone or something that is extremely successful, often because of special qualities or abilities
phenomenon.chi_def: 非凡的人（或事物）；奇才；奇跡
phenomenon.eg: The Beatles were a phenomenon - nobody had heard anything like them before.

philosopher.eng_def: someone who studies or writes about the meaning of life

philosophical.eng_def: relating to the study or writing of philosophy
If you are philosophical in your reaction to something that is not satisfactory, you accept it calmly and without anger, understanding that failure and disappointment are a part of life.
philosophical.chi_def: 豁達的，達觀的；泰然自若的

philosophy.eng_def: the use of reason in understanding such things as the nature of the real world and existence, the use and limits of knowledge, and the principles of moral judgment
philosophy.eg: René Descartes is regarded as the founder of modern philosophy.

philosophy.eng_def: a group of theories and ideas related to the understanding of a particular subject
a particular system of beliefs, values, and principles
philosophy.eg: the Ancient Greek philosophy of Stoicism

philosophy.eng_def: the way that someone thinks about life and deals with it
philosophy.chi_def: 人生哲學；生活（或工作）準則
philosophy.eg: Live now, pay later - that's my philosophy of life!

phone.eng_def: a device that uses either a system of wires along which electrical signals are sent or a system of radio signals to make it possible for you to speak to someone in another place who has a similar device

phone.eg: That son of mine is on the phone all day!

phone.eng_def: to have a landline in the home
phone.eg: Are the Middletons on the phone at their cottage, do you know?

phone.eng_def: a unit of sound at the phonetic level, used when studying speech
to communicate with someone by phone

photo.eg: She took lots of photos of the kids.

photo.eng_def: relating to or produced by light

photograph.eng_def: a picture produced using a camera
to take a picture using a camera
photograph.eg: I prefer photographing people rather than places.

photographer.eng_def: a person who takes photographs, either as a job or hobby

photographic.eng_def: relating to, used for, or produced by photography

photography.eng_def: the activity or job of taking photographs or filming
photography.eg: She's taking an evening class in photography.

phrase.eng_def: a group of words that is part of, rather than the whole of, a sentence
a short group of words that are often used together and have a particular meaning
phrase.eg: We are governed, in Lord Hailsham's famous phrase, by an "elective dictatorship".

phrase.eng_def: a small group of notes forming a unit of a tune
to express something with a particular choice of words
phrase.chi_def: 用…方式表達，以…措辭表達
phrase.eg: The declaration was carefully/cleverly/tactfully, etc. phrased.

physical.eg: The referee stepped in because the game had started to get a little too physical.
There was obviously a great physical attraction between them.

physical.eng_def: relating to things you can see or touch, or relating to the laws of nature
physical.chi_def: 實物的；物質的；有形的；按自然規律的

physical.eng_def: an examination of a person's body by a doctor in order to discover if that person is healthy, sometimes done before a person can be accepted for a particular job

physician.eng_def: a medical doctor, especially one who has general skill and is not a surgeon

physicist.eng_def: a person who studies physics or whose job is connected with physics

physics.eng_def: the scientific study of matter and energy and the effect that they have on each other

piano.eng_def: a large musical instrument with a row of black and white keys that are pressed to play notes

pick.eng_def: to take some things and leave others
pick.eg: Pick a card from the pack.

pick.eng_def: to take some things but not others
pick.eg: The richest universities can pick and choose which students they take.

pick.eng_def: to remove separate things or small pieces from something, especially with the fingers
pick.eg: I picked a piece of fluff off my shiny black suit.

pick.eng_def: When you pick flowers or fruit, you take them off a plant or tree.
pick.eg: They were picking strawberries for twelve hours a day.

pick.eng_def: When you pick a string on a guitar or similar instrument, you pull it quickly and release it suddenly with your fingers to produce a note.
pick.chi_def: 彈撥，彈奏（吉他等弦樂器）

pick.eg: You can have first pick of the desserts.

pick.eng_def: to have a large choice available
pick.eg: The plane was fairly empty so we had our pick of seats.

pick.eng_def: to choose the one(s) you want from the different types available
pick.eg: The shirts come in five different colours - just take your pick.

pick.eng_def: especially in combinations, a sharp pointed tool
a small, thin piece of plastic, metal, etc. that isheld between the fingers and thumb and usedfor playing instruments such as the guitar

pickle.eng_def: vegetables or fruit that have been preserved in a vinegar sauce or salty water
a cucumber that has been preserved in vinegar or salty water, or slices of this
to preserve vegetables or fruit in a vinegar sauce or salty water
pickle.eg: The onions had been pickled in brine.

pickpocket.eng_def: a thief who steals things out of pockets or bags, especially in a crowd
to steal things out of people's pockets or bags, especially in a crowd

picnic.eng_def: an occasion when you have an informal meal of sandwiches, etc. outside, or the food itself
picnic.eg: If the weather's nice we could have a picnic in the park.
There were several families picnicking on the river bank.

picture.eg: Freddy drew/painted a picture of my dog.

picture.eng_def: an image seen on a television or cinema screen
picture.eg: We can't get a clear picture.
Could this be the first animated movie to win a best picture award?
Let's go to the pictures tonight.

picture.eng_def: something you produce in your mind, by using your imagination or memory
picture.eg: I have a very vivid picture of the first time I met Erik.
After watching the news, I had a clearer picture of what was happening.

picture.eng_def: a situation described in a particular way
picture.eg: The experts are painting a gloomy/brighter/rosy picture of the state of the economy.
Picture the scene - the crowds of people and animals, the noise, the dirt.

picturesque.eng_def: (especially of a place) attractive in appearance, especially in an old-fashioned way
picturesque.chi_def: （尤指某地）美麗的，古色古香的
picturesque.eg: the picturesque narrow streets of the old city

pie.eng_def: a type of food made with meat, vegetables, or fruit covered in pastry and baked
pie.eg: Would you like some more steak pie?

piece.eg: a piece of cloth torn from her coat

piece.eng_def: as a single thing and not divided into smaller pieces
piece.eg: We want to sell the business in one piece.

piece.eng_def: to break apart into smaller parts
piece.eg: The glass must have been cracked - it just fell to pieces in my hand.

piece.eng_def: a single object of a particular type
piece.chi_def: （某類事物中的）一件，一個，一條

piece.eng_def: something that has been created by an artist, musician, or writer
piece.chi_def: （藝術家、音樂家或作家的）作品；篇，段，首，幅

piece.eng_def: a single thing that forms part of a set
a coin with a stated value
piece.eg: Could you swap me two quarters for a 50 cent piece?

piece.eng_def: with the number of pieces mentioned
piece.eg: a five-piece band (= with five players)

pier.eng_def: a long structure sticking out from the land over the sea, where people can walk or large boats can be tied, sometimes with restaurants and places of entertainment on it
a low structure built at the edge of water, used especially for getting into and out of boats
a strong thick column used to support a wall, roof, or other structure

pierce.eng_def: to go into or through something, making a hole in it using a sharp point
pierce.eg: The needle pierces the fabric four times a second.

pierce.eng_def: (of a light, sound, etc.) to suddenly be seen or heard, despite darkness, noise, etc.
pierce.eg: A few rays of sunlight pierced the smoke.

piety.eng_def: strong belief in a religion that is shown in the way someone lives

pig.eng_def: a large pink, brown, or black farm animal with short legs and a curved tail, kept for its meat
pig.eg: The meat produced from a pig is called pork, bacon, or ham.

pig.eng_def: a person who is unpleasant and difficult to deal with
pig.chi_def: 令人討厭的人，難相處的人
pig.eg: He was an absolute pig to her.

pig.eng_def: to be very difficult or unpleasant to do, play, etc.
pig.eg: It's a beautiful piece of music but it's a pig to play.

pig.eng_def: a person who eats too much
pig.eg: You greedy pig! You're not having another biscuit!

pigeon.eng_def: a large, usually grey bird that is often seen in towns sitting on buildings in large groups, and is sometimes eaten as food
a pigeon kept as a pet in order to take part in flying competitions

pile.eng_def: objects positioned one on top of another
a mass of something that has been placed somewhere

pile.eg: I've got piles/a pile of things to do today.

pile.eng_def: a strong column or post of wood, metal, or concrete that is pushed into the ground to help support a building
the soft surface made by the ends of many short threads on a carpet or on cloth such as velvet
pile.chi_def: （地毯或天鵝絨等布料的）絨面

pile.eg: They've got a great big Victorian pile somewhere out in the country.

pile.eng_def: to arrange objects into a pile
pile.eg: We piled plenty of logs up next to the fire.

pile.eng_def: (of a group of people) to move together, especially in an uncontrolled way
pile.eg: As soon as the train stopped, they all piled in/out.

pilgrim.eng_def: a person who makes a journey, often a long and difficult one, to a special place for religious reasons

pill.eng_def: a small solid piece of medicine that a person swallows without chewing (= crushing with the teeth)
a type of pill for women that is taken every day in order to prevent them from becoming pregnant

pill.eg: Jennifer was being such a pill today.

pill.eng_def: a small ball of threads that develops on the surface of clothes or material
pill.chi_def: （衣服或布料上的）球粒，纖維絨球
pill.eg: She sat there sulking and picking the pills off her sweater.

pill.eng_def: If a piece of clothing or material pills, it develops small balls of threads on its surface.
pill.chi_def: （衣服或布料）起球粒，起纖維絨球

pillar.eng_def: a strong column made of stone, metal, or wood that supports part of a building
pillar.eg: A row of reinforced concrete pillars supports the bridge.

pillar.eng_def: a very important member or part of a group, organization, system, etc.
pillar.eg: Mrs Maple is a pillar of the local church.

pillow.eng_def: a rectangular cloth bag filled with soft material, such as feathers or artificial materials, used for resting your head on in bed
pillow.eg: Do you prefer a feather pillow or a foam pillow?

pilot.eng_def: a person who flies an aircraft
a person with detailed knowledge of an area of water, such as that around a port, who goes onto a ship to direct it safely
pilot.chi_def: （船隻的）領航員，領港員；引水人

pilot.eng_def: a programme that is made to introduce a new radio or television series and test how popular it is
pilot.eg: If you'd seen the pilot, you'd know why they decided not to make a complete series of programmes!

pilot.eng_def: a small flame that burns all the time in a gas device, such as a cooker or a device for heating water, and that starts the main flame burning when the gas is turned on
pilot.chi_def: （灶具等的）母火，引火用的常燃小火苗

pilot.eng_def: A pilot plan, product, or system is used to test how good something is before introducing it.
pilot.eg: If the pilot scheme is successful, many more homes will be offered the new television service.
She piloted the aircraft to safety after one of the engines failed.

pilot.eng_def: to test a new product before it is sold
pilot.eg: We shall pilot several new cosmetic products to selected potential purchasers.

pilot.eng_def: to be responsible for introducing a new law or system and making certain it is established
pilot.chi_def: 使（新的法律或制度）順利通過
pilot.eg: 20 years ago he piloted a bill through Parliament on working conditions.

pilot.eng_def: to direct a ship into a port or through an area of water

pimple.eng_def: a small raised spot on the skin that is temporary

pin.eng_def: a small thin piece of metal with a point at one end, especially used for temporarily holding pieces of cloth together
pin.chi_def: （尤指用於固定布料用的）別針，大頭針
pin.eg: I'll keep the trouser patch in place with pins while I sew it on.
If you pull the pin out of a hand-grenade, it'll explode.

pin.eng_def: a decorative object, used as jewellery

pin.eg: Grandpa's very old now and he's very shaky on his pins.

pin.eng_def: In the game of chess, a pin is a special move that stops the other player from moving one of their pieces, because to move it will put another more valuable piece in danger.
pin.chi_def: 牽制，困子（西洋棋中「牽制」或「困子」是特殊的一步，移動後可阻止另一方移動某棋子，因為移動該棋子會使另一個更重要的棋子有危險）
pin.eg: That nasty pin stopped me from moving my knight.

pin.eng_def: to fasten something with a pin
pin.eg: A large picture of the president was pinned to/(up) on the office wall.

pin.eng_def: When a young man pins a young woman, he gives her a piece of jewellery to show that they love each other.
pin.chi_def: （青年男子）向（青年女子）贈送首飾

pin.eng_def: to force someone or something to stay in a particular place by putting weight on him, her, or it
pin.eg: She was pinned (down) under a pile of rubble.

pin.eng_def: abbreviation for  personal identification number : a secret number that a person uses together with a special card to get money from their bank account out of a machine, or when paying by credit card
pin.chi_def: 個人身分識別碼；銀行卡密碼（personal identification number 的縮寫）

pinch.eng_def: to press something, especially someone's skin, strongly between two hard things such as a finger and a thumb, usually causing pain
You say that you have to pinch yourself if you cannot really believe something that has happened because it is so good or so strange
pinch.chi_def: 掐自己一下（表示某事太好或太奇怪，簡直令人難以置信）

pluck.eng_def: to remove the feathers from a chicken or other bird so that it can be cooked and eaten
to remove someone suddenly from a situation that is ordinary
pluck.eg: He was plucked from obscurity to star in the film.

pluck.eng_def: to remove someone quickly from a dangerous or difficult situation
pluck.eg: The last passengers were plucked from the ship just seconds before it sank.

pluck.eng_def: to collect flowers by breaking or cutting their stems; pick
to pull and then release the strings of a musical instrument with your finger to play notes
pluck.eg: He sat on the bed, idly plucking (at) the strings of his guitar.

pluck.eng_def: courage and a strong wish to succeed
pluck.eg: She showed a lot of pluck in standing up to her boss.

plug.eng_def: a small plastic or rubber object with two or three metal pins, attached to the end of a wire on a piece of electrical equipment and pushed into a special opening in a wall to connect the equipment to a supply of electricity

plug.eg: Is there a plug in the bedroom that I can use for my hairdryer?

plug.eng_def: a metal pin at the end of a long wire joined to a piece of electrical equipment and used to connect it to another piece of electrical equipment

plug.chi_def: 火花塞（spark plug的非正式說法）

plug.eng_def: a small piece of rubber, plastic, wood, etc. that fits into a hole in order to close it
a round piece of rubber or plastic that fits into the hole in a sink or a bath
a small piece of plastic or wood that you put into a hole in a wall before putting a screw into it
plug.chi_def: （打入牆上孔內以旋進螺絲釘的）螺釘楔子，螺釘栓塞

plug.eng_def: a small piece of material such as cotton wool, twisted or pressed tightly so it is firm
the act of telling people publicly about a product, event, etc.
plug.eg: She never misses an opportunity to get in a plug for her new film.

plug.eng_def: to advertise something by talking about it a lot or praising it, especially on the radio or television
plug.chi_def: （尤指透過廣播或電視）宣傳，推廣
plug.eg: That interview was just a way for him to plug his new book.

plug.eng_def: to shoot someone with a gun
plug.eg: Sure, boss, we plugged the guy (full of lead).

plug.eng_def: to fill a hole with a piece of suitable material
plug.eg: Have you plugged that leak (= stopped it by filling the hole) in the pipe?

plum.eng_def: a small, round fruit with a thin, smooth, red, purple, or yellow skin, sweet, soft flesh, and a single large, hard seed

plum.eg: How did you manage to get such a plum job?

plumber.eng_def: a person whose job is to supply and connect or repair water pipes, baths, toilets, etc.
plumber.eg: When is the plumber coming to repair the burst pipe?

plunge.eng_def: to (cause someone or something to) move or fall suddenly and often a long way forward, down, or into something
plunge.chi_def: （使）（某人或某物）驟然移動，驟然下降
plunge.eg: We ran down to the beach and plunged into the sea.

plunge.eng_def: to become lower in value or level very suddenly and quickly
plunge.eg: The fall in demand caused share prices to plunge.

plunge.eng_def: a sudden movement or fall forward, down, or into something
plunge.eg: I really enjoyed my plunge (= jumping in and swimming) in the pool.

plunge.eng_def: a sudden and large fall in value or level
plunge.eg: We are expecting a plunge in profits this year.

plural.eng_def: a word or form that expresses more than one
consisting of lots of different races or types of people or of different things
plural.eg: We need to recognize that we are now living in a plural society.

plural.eng_def: for or relating to more than one person or thing
plural.eg: Very few countries allow people to have plural citizenship (= citizenship of more than one country).

plural.eng_def: of or relating to the form that expresses more than one

plus.eg: There will be two adults travelling, plus three children.

plus.eng_def: an advantage or a good feature
plus.eg: Your teaching experience will be a plus in this job.

plus.eng_def: the (+) sign, written between two numbers to show that they should be added together
A plus number or amount is more than zero.
plus.eg: Plus 8 is eight more than zero.

plus.eng_def: more than the number or amount mentioned
used by teachers after a letter, such as B or C, to show that the standard of a piece of work is slightly higher than the stated mark
plus.eg: I got C plus/C+ for my essay.

plus.eng_def: used to describe an advantage or good quality that something has
plus.eg: The house is near the sea, which is a plus factor for us.

pneumonia.eng_def: a serious illness in which one or both lungs become red and swollen and filled with liquid
pneumonia.eg: People who are bedridden can easily get pneumonia.

pneumonia.eng_def: to make yourself ill by getting too cold
pneumonia.eg: She'll catch pneumonia going out without a coat in this weather!

poach.eng_def: to cook something such as a fish, or an egg with its shell removed, by putting it in gently boiling water or other liquid
poach.eg: We had poached eggs for breakfast.

poach.eng_def: to catch and kill animals without permission on someone else's land
poach.chi_def: （侵入他人地界）偷獵，偷捕；盜獵
poach.eg: The farmer claimed that he shot the men because they were poaching on his land.

poach.eng_def: to take and use for yourself unfairly or dishonestly something, usually an idea, that belongs to someone else
poach.chi_def: 以不當手段獲取，竊用（想法等）
poach.eg: Jeff always poaches my ideas, and then pretends that they're his own.

poach.eng_def: to persuade someone who works for someone else to come and work for you
poach.eg: They were furious when one of their best managers was poached by another company.

poacher.eng_def: someone who catches and kills animals illegally
in football, a forward who scores a lot goals from a position close to the goal
poacher.chi_def: （足球比賽中的）經常在禁區近球門處射門得分的前鋒

pocket.eng_def: a small bag for carrying things in, made of cloth and sewn into the inside or onto the outside of a piece of clothing
a container, usually made of cloth, that is sewn into or onto a bag or attached to a seat or door in a vehicle
pocket.chi_def: （附於袋子、車門、車座椅等處的）口袋，袋子
pocket.eg: Sarah put her maps in the outside pocket of her rucksack.

pocket.eng_def: one of several holes around the edge of a billiard or snooker table, into which balls are hit
the amount of money that someone has for spending
pocket.eg: You need deep pockets (= a lot of money) if you're involved in a long law suit.

pocket.eng_def: a group, area, or mass of something that is separate and different from what surrounds it
pocket.chi_def: 小塊地區（或團體、部分）；孤立地區（或團體、部分）
pocket.eg: Among the staff there are some pockets of resistance to the planned changes (= some small groups of them are opposed).

pocket.eng_def: to put something into your pocket
to hit a billiard or snooker ball into a pocket
pocket.eg: Davis pocketed the black to win the game.

pocket.eng_def: to take something for yourself, especially dishonestly
pocket.eg: I'll tell them I sold it for £20, not £25, then I can pocket the rest.

pocket.eng_def: used to describe something that is small enough to put in your pocket, or that you regularly carry in your pocket

pocketbook.eg: I need a new pocketbook to go with these shoes.

pocketbook.eng_def: the money that someone has, or someone's ability to pay for things
pocketbook.eg: These new tax laws will hit everyone's pocketbook.

poem.eng_def: a piece of writing in which the words are arranged in separate lines, often ending in rhyme, and are chosen for their sound and for the images and ideas they suggest

poetic.eng_def: like or relating to poetry or poets
poetic.eg: a collection of Dryden's poetical works (= poems)

poetic.chi_def: 極美的；充滿詩意的；詩情畫意的
poetic.eg: Deanne Sokolin creates abstract, mournfully poetic black-and-white images of wrapped objects.

poetry.eng_def: poems in general as a form of literature
a very beautiful or emotional quality
poetry.eg: This film has a savage poetry and brilliance.

point.eng_def: an idea, opinion, or piece of information that is said or written
point.eg: I'd like to discuss the first point in your essay.

point.eng_def: the meaning or most important part of what someone says or writes
point.eg: The point is, if you don't claim the money now you might never get it.

point.eng_def: an opinion or fact that deserves to be considered seriously, or that other people agree is true
point.eg: Yes, I can see your point/you've got a point there.

point.eng_def: not important or not related to the subject being discussed
point.chi_def: 不重要的；離題的，不相關的
point.eg: The fact that he doesn't want to come is beside the point - he should have been invited.

point.eng_def: said to show that what someone has just said is true or important
point.eg: "We'll take the bus." "But we don't have any money for the fare." "That's a point."

point.eng_def: a particular time or stage reached in a process
point.eg: At that point, a soldier opened fire on the car.

point.eng_def: a particular place
point.eg: the point where the road bends

point.eng_def: the temperature at which a substance boils, melts, freezes, etc.
purpose or usefulness
point.eg: There's no point arguing about it - we're going and that's that.

point.eng_def: a mark or unit for counting, especially how much a person or team has scored in a sport
point.eg: The youngest skier won the most points.

point.eng_def: a unit used for measuring the size of printed letters, equal to about 0.3 mm or 1/72 of an inch
point.chi_def: 點，磅值（印刷字型大小的計量單位，約等於0.3毫米）
point.eg: The large letters are in 7.5 point type, and the small letters are in 6 point.

point.eng_def: the sharp end of something, such as a knife
point.eg: The knife landed with its point sticking into the floor.

point.eng_def: a particular quality or characteristic of a person or thing
point.eg: There are various points to look out for when you're judging dogs in a competition.

point.eng_def: a long, thin area of land that stretches out into the sea
point.eg: Spurn Point

point.eng_def: a small, round spot that is used in numbers to separate whole numbers from parts of numbers
point.eg: One kilogram equals two point two (= 2.2) pounds.

point.eng_def: the toes of a ballet dancer's shoes
point.eg: She is learning how to dance on her points.

point.eng_def: a socket to which a wire from a piece of electrical equipment is connected in order to supply it with electricity or a radio, television, or other signal
point.eg: a TV antenna point

point.eng_def: in some car engines, either of two parts that allow or prevent the flow of electricity
point.eg: He checked the points and plugs and topped up the oil.

point.eng_def: a place on a railway track where the rails (= metal bars on which the trains travel) can be moved to allow a train to change from one track to another
point.eg: The train rattled as it went over the points.

point.eng_def: a small, round mark on a line, plan, or map to show the position of something
point.eg: Join the points A and B together on the diagram with a straight line.

point.eng_def: a mark on a compass that shows direction, such as north, south, east, and west
a very small, round light that you can see in the distance
point.eg: I could just make out the tiny points of a car's headlights far away.

point.eng_def: to direct other people's attention to something by holding out your finger towards it
point.eg: "Look at that!" she said, pointing at the hole in the door.

point.eng_def: to hold something out in the direction of someone or something
point.eg: He said that the man had pointed a knife at him.

point.eng_def: If something points in a particular direction, it is turned towards that direction.
point.eg: The road sign points left.

point.eng_def: relating to when a ballet dancer dances on their toes
point.eg: a pair of point shoes

poison.eng_def: a substance that can make people or animals ill or kill them if they eat or drink it
poison.eg: The pest control officer put bowls of rat poison in the attic.

poison.eng_def: to kill a person or animal or to make them very ill by giving them poison
poison.eg: Four members of the family had been poisoned, but not fatally.

poison.eng_def: to put poison in someone's food or drink
poison.eg: He said that someone had poisoned his coffee.

poison.eng_def: to add dangerous chemicals or other harmful substances to something such as water or air
poison.eg: The chemical leak had poisoned the water supply.

poison.eng_def: to spoil a friendship or another situation, by making it very unpleasant
poison.eg: The long dispute has poisoned relations between the two countries.

poisonous.eng_def: very harmful and able to cause illness or death
A poisonous animal or insect uses poison in order to defend itself.

poisonous.eg: He said some poisonous things to me.

poke.eng_def: to push a finger or other pointed object quickly into someone or something
poke.eg: You'll poke someone in the eye with that umbrella if you're not careful!

poke.eng_def: to (cause something to) appear or stretch out from behind or through something else
poke.eg: Cathy poked her head round the door to say hello.

poke.eng_def: to greet someone on a social networking website by leaving them a special short message
poke.chi_def: （在社群網路上）通過留言問候對方

poke.eng_def: the act of poking someone or something
poke.eg: She gave me a poke in the stomach.

polar.eng_def: relating to the North or South Pole or the areas around them

polar.eg: The novel deals with the polar opposites of love and hate.

pole.eng_def: a long, thin stick of wood or metal, often used standing straight up in the ground to support things
either of the two points at the most northern and most southern ends of the earth, around which the earth turns
either of two completely opposite or different opinions, positions, or qualities
pole.chi_def: （意見、立場或特點）截然相反的一端，極端

police.eng_def: the official organization that is responsible for protecting people and property, making people obey the law, finding out about and solving crime, and catching people who have committed a crime
police.eg: I think you should call the police.
There should be more police patrolling the area on foot.

police.eng_def: to control or guard a public event or area by using members of the police or a similar force
police.chi_def: 維持…的治安，巡查；在…部署員警
police.eg: The march will be heavily policed by an anti-riot unit.

police.eng_def: to control the way in which a possibly dangerous substance is dealt with or a dangerous activity is done
police.eg: The use of these chemicals must be carefully policed.

policeman.eng_def: a male member of a police force

policy.eng_def: a set of ideas or a plan of what to do in particular situations that has been agreed to officially by a group of people, a business organization, a government, or a political party
policy.eg: They believe that Europe needs a common foreign and security policy.

policy.eng_def: a document showing an agreement you have made with an insurance company
policy.eg: You should check your policy to see if you're covered for flood damage.

polish.eng_def: to rub something using a piece of cloth or brush to clean it and make it shine
the act of cleaning something by rubbing it
polish.eg: I'll just give my shoes a quick polish.

polish.eng_def: a cream or other substance that you use to clean something
the quality of having been done in a way that shows skill and experience

polish.eng_def: belonging to or relating to Poland, its people, or its language
polish.chi_def: 波蘭人的；波蘭的；波蘭語的

polite.eng_def: behaving in a way that is socially correct and shows understanding of and care for other people's feelings
polite.eg: I'm afraid I wasn't very polite to her.

polite.eng_def: people who have been taught how to behave in a socially correct way
polite.eg: Sex never used to be discussed in polite society.

politician.eng_def: a member of a government or law-making organization

politics.eng_def: the activities of the government, members of law-making organizations, or people who try to influence the way a country is governed
politics.eg: Joe is very active in left-wing politics.

politics.eng_def: the job of holding a position of power in the government
politics.eg: The group is campaigning to get more women into politics.

politics.eng_def: the study of the ways in which a country is governed
politics.eg: She studied politics at Leicester University.

politics.eng_def: someone's opinions about how a country should be governed
politics.chi_def: （某人的）政治見解，（某人的）政治觀點

politics.eng_def: the relationships within a group or organization that allow particular people to have power over others
politics.chi_def: （團體或組織內的）爭權奪勢，權術，勾心鬥角

poll.eng_def: a study in which people are asked for their opinions about a subject or person
poll.eg: We're carrying out/conducting a poll to find out what people think about abortion.

poll.eng_def: the places where people vote in a political election

The country will go to the polls on 13 September.

poll.eng_def: When a person or a political party polls a particular number of votes in an election, they receive that number.
poll.eg: With nearly all the votes counted, Mr Soto had polled 67 percent of the vote.

poll.eng_def: to ask a person for their opinion as part of a general study of what people think about a subject
poll.eg: Half the people polled said they would pay more for environmentally friendly food.

pollutant.eg: Sulphur dioxide is one of several pollutants that are released into the atmosphere by coal-fired power stations.

pollute.eng_def: to make an area or substance, usually air, water, or soil, dirty or harmful to people, animals, and plants, especially by adding harmful chemicals
pollute.eg: The pesticides used on many farms are polluting the water supply.

pollution.eng_def: damage caused to water, air, etc. by harmful substances or waste

pond.eng_def: an area of water smaller than a lake, often artificially made
a humorous way of referring to the Atlantic Ocean, when it is thought of as separating the UK or Europe and the US
pond.chi_def: （幽默的說法）大西洋（指其將英國和歐洲與美國分開）

ponder.eng_def: to think carefully about something, especially for a noticeable length of time
ponder.eg: She sat back for a minute to ponder her next move in the game.

pony.eg: As a young girl, she spent every weekend riding her pony.

pool.eng_def: a small area of usually still water
pool.eg: We looked for crabs in the rock pools along the seashore.

pool.eng_def: a small amount of liquid on a surface

pool.eg: I spent most of my holiday lying/sunbathing by the pool.

pool.eng_def: a number of people or a quantity of a particular thing, such as money, collected together for shared use by several people or organizations
pool.chi_def: 共用人員；共用資金；共用資源

pool.eng_def: in some card games, an amount of money that is collected from all the players and received by the player who wins the game

pool.eng_def: the money risked by a number of people on the result of a game or event
a type of gambling in which people risk a small amount of money and try to guess the results of football games correctly and win a lot of money
pool.eg: They do the pools every week.

pool.eng_def: a game in which two people use cues (= long, thin poles) to hit 16 coloured balls into six holes around the edge of a large table covered in soft cloth

pool.chi_def: （為不同人士或團體）集合（資金／資源）
pool.eg: The kids pooled their money to buy their parents a wedding anniversary gift.

poor.eng_def: having little money and/or few possessions
poor.eg: Most of the world's poorest countries are in Africa.

poor.eng_def: to have very little of a particular substance or quality
poor.eg: Unfortunately, Iceland is poor in natural resources.

poor.eng_def: not good; being of a very low quality, quantity, or standard

poor.eg: That cold sounds terrible, you poor thing!

poor.eng_def: poor people considered together as a group

pop.eng_def: modern popular music, usually with a strong beat, created with electrical or electronic equipment, and easy to listen to and remember
a short, sharp sound like something exploding
pop.eg: I heard a pop and the lights went out.
Hey Pop, can I do anything to help?

pop.eng_def: a sweet fizzy drink (= with bubbles), usually with a fruit flavour
to criticize someone, especially in public
pop.chi_def: （尤指當眾）批評（某人），指責（某人）
pop.eg: She never expected anyone from her own family to take a pop at her.

pop.eng_def: each particular occasion or object in a series
pop.eg: She gives lectures and gets paid $5,000 a pop.

pop.eng_def: to go to a particular place
pop.eg: I've just got to pop into the bank to get some money.

pop.eng_def: to (cause something to) make a short explosive sound, often by breaking something
pop.eg: The kids were popping all the birthday balloons.

pop.eng_def: If your ears pop, you experience a strange noise and feeling in your ears as a result of a sudden change in air pressure.
pop.eg: My ears always pop as the plane comes in to land.

pop.eng_def: to move quickly and suddenly, especially from a closed space
pop.chi_def: （尤指從封閉的空間）爆開，彈出來
pop.eg: When you open the box, a clown pops out.

pop.eng_def: to put or take something quickly
pop.eg: If you pop the pizza in the oven now, it'll be ready in 15 minutes.

pop.eng_def: to take pills regularly, especially ones containing an illegal drug
pop.chi_def: 經常性服藥；（尤指）服用違法藥品，磕藥
pop.eg: A decade of heavy drinking and popping pills ruined her health.

pop.eng_def: to open or release something quickly
pop.chi_def: 迅速地打開；迅速地放開
pop.eg: The taxi driver said that he stopped immediately and popped the trunk.

pop.eng_def: enjoyed by many people and easy to understand
pop.chi_def: 流行的（許多人欣賞且容易理解的）
pop.eg: Dario Fo, the famous Italian playwright, is a pop Pirandello.
The village (pop. 3,915) is a bustling river port.

popcorn.eng_def: seeds of maize that are heated until they break open and become soft and light, usually flavoured with salt, butter, or sugar

popular.eng_def: liked, enjoyed, or supported by many people
popular.chi_def: 受大眾喜愛的，受歡迎的
popular.eg: She's the most popular teacher in school.

popular.eng_def: for or involving ordinary people rather than experts or very educated people

popularity.eng_def: the fact that something or someone is liked, enjoyed, or supported by many people
popularity.eg: the increasing popularity of organic food

populate.eng_def: If an area is populated by people or animals, they live in that area.
populate.chi_def: 構成…的人口（或動物的總數）
populate.eg: The inner cities are no longer densely populated.

populate.eng_def: to live in an area or place
populate.eg: The settlers began to move inland and populate the river valleys.

populate.eng_def: to automatically add information to a list or table on a computer
populate.chi_def: （在電腦的清單或表格上）自動增加資料
populate.eg: There are several ways to populate the database.

population.eng_def: all the people living in a particular country, area, or place
population.eg: Ten percent of the population lived in poverty.

population.eng_def: all the people or animals of a particular type or group who live in one country, area, or place
population.chi_def: （統稱）（一定範圍內的）人口，動物總數
population.eg: There's been a nine percent rise in the prison population (= the number of people in prison).

porcelain.eng_def: a hard but delicate, shiny, white substance made by heating a special type of clay to a high temperature, used to make cups, plates, decorations, etc.
cups, plates, and decorations, etc. made of porcelain
porcelain.eg: He had a fine collection of Meissen porcelain.

porch.eng_def: a covered structure in front of the entrance to a building

porch.eg: We sat out on the porch to cool off.

pork.eng_def: meat from a pig, eaten as food

port.eng_def: a town by the sea or by a river that has a harbour, or the harbour itself
a part of a computer where wires from other pieces of equipment, such as a printer, can be connected
the left side of a ship or aircraft
a strong, sweet wine made in Portugal
port.chi_def: 波爾多葡萄酒（葡萄牙產）

portable.eng_def: light and small enough to be easily carried or moved
possible to take with you if you move to a different place or job
portable.chi_def: （在換工作或地點之後）可轉移的
portable.eg: They offer portable pensions, carried by employees from job to job.

porter.eng_def: a person whose job is to carry things, especially travellers' bags at railway stations, airports, hotels etc.
porter.chi_def: 搬運工；（尤指火車站、機場等的）行李員；挑夫
porter.eg: There aren't any porters, so we'll have to find a trolley for the luggage.

porter.eng_def: someone whose job is to take care of a large building where many people live and be present at its entrance in order to help people who live or visit there
porter.eg: The porter opened the door for me and then called a taxi.

porter.eng_def: a person whose job is to help travellers who are spending the night on a train by arranging their bed, taking care of their bags, etc.

portion.eng_def: a part or share of something larger
portion.eg: A large/major portion of the company's profit goes straight back into new projects.

portion.eng_def: the amount of a particular food that is served to one person, especially in a restaurant or a shop that sells food ready to be eaten
portion.eg: The portions are very generous in this restaurant.

portrait.eng_def: a painting, photograph, drawing, etc. of a person or, less commonly, of a group of people
portrait.eg: She's commissioned an artist to paint her portrait/paint a portrait of her.

portrait.eng_def: A film or book that is a portrait of something describes or represents that thing in a detailed way.
portrait.chi_def: 電影（或書中）的描寫，描述；表現
portrait.eg: Her latest novel paints a very vivid portrait of the aristocracy in the 1920s.

portrait.eng_def: A portrait computer document is to be printed with the shorter side of the paper at the top and bottom.
portrait.chi_def: 縱向（描述電腦文檔列印的一種方式，即紙的短邊置於頂部和底部）

portray.eng_def: to represent or describe someone or something in a painting, film, book, or other artistic work
portray.eg: The painting portrays a beautiful young woman in a blue dress.

portray.eng_def: If a person in a film, book, etc. is portrayed as a particular type of character, they are represented in that way.
portray.chi_def: 把（某人）刻畫成，將（某人）塑造成
portray.eg: The father in the film is portrayed as a fairly unpleasant character.

pose.eng_def: to cause something, especially a problem or difficulty
pose.chi_def: 造成，引起（尤指問題或困難）
pose.eg: Nuclear weapons pose a threat to everyone.

pose.eng_def: to ask a question, especially in a formal situation such as a meeting
pose.chi_def: （尤指在正式場合）提出（問題），質詢
pose.eg: Can we go back to the question that Helena posed earlier?

pose.eng_def: to move into and stay in a particular position, in order to be photographed, painted, etc.
pose.eg: We all posed for our photographs next to the Statue of Liberty.

pose.eng_def: to pretend to be something that you are not or to have qualities that you do not have, in order to be admired or attract interest
pose.eg: He doesn't really know a thing about the theatre - he's just posing!

pose.eng_def: a particular position in which a person stands, sits, etc. in order to be photographed, painted, etc.
pose.chi_def: （為拍照、畫像等擺出的）樣子，姿勢
