referee.eng_def: a person who is in charge of a sports game and who makes certain that the rules are followed
referee.eg: We only lost the game because the referee was biased.

referee.eng_def: a person or organization that helps to find a fair answer to a disagreement
referee.eg: A judge is acting as referee in the pay dispute between the trade union and management.

referee.eng_def: a person who knows you and who is willing to describe and, usually, praise you, in order to support you when you are trying to get a job, etc.
referee.chi_def: （通常指給予褒揚的）證明人，介紹人，推薦人
referee.eg: She gave her college tutor as her referee to the interviewer.

referee.eng_def: to be a referee in a game
referee.eg: They had to ask one of the spectators to referee (the match).

reference.eg: Knowing what had happened, I avoided making any reference to (= mentioning) weddings.

reference.eng_def: a writer or a book, article, etc. that is mentioned in a piece of writing, showing you where particular information was found
in a business letter, a number that tells you who to speak to or where to look for more information
reference.chi_def: （商務信函中為方便查詢所用的）標識，編號，標記
reference.eg: In all future letters on this subject, please use/quote our reference JW/155/C.

reference.eng_def: a letter that is written by someone who knows you, to describe you and say if you are suitable for a job, course, etc.
reference.eg: My old headteacher said he would write/give me a glowing (= very good) reference.

reference.eng_def: a quick look at a book, piece of paper, etc. in order to find information and help
reference.eg: He made the whole speech without reference to the notes in front of him.

refine.eng_def: to make something pure or improve something, especially by removing unwanted material
refine.chi_def: （尤指去除不需要的雜質而）精煉，提煉，提純
refine.eg: Crude oil is industrially refined to purify it and separate out the different elements, such as benzene.

refine.eng_def: to improve an idea, method, system, etc. by making small changes
refine.eg: Engineers spent many months refining the software.

refinement.eng_def: the process of making a substance pure
refinement.eg: The refinement of raw opium yields other drugs, such as morphine.

refinement.eng_def: a small change that improves something
refinement.eg: These refinements have increased the machine's accuracy by 25 percent.

refinement.eng_def: a quality of politeness and education
refinement.eg: She's the personification of culture and refinement.

reflect.eng_def: If a surface reflects light, heat, sound, or an image, it sends the light, etc. back and does not absorb it.
reflect.chi_def: 反射（光、熱、聲等）；反映，映出（影像）
reflect.eg: He saw himself reflected in the water/mirror/shop window.

reflect.eng_def: to show, express, or be a sign of something
reflect.eg: The statistics reflect a change in people's spending habits.

reflect.eng_def: to think carefully, especially about possibilities and opinions
reflect.chi_def: 深思，考慮，認真思考（尤指可能性或意見）
reflect.eg: The manager demanded time to reflect (on what to do).

reflection.eng_def: the image of something in a mirror or on any reflective surface
reflection.chi_def: 映射；映照出的影像；反射
reflection.eg: In Greek mythology, Narcissus fell in love with his own reflection in a pool of water.

reflection.eng_def: the return of light, heat, sound, or energy from a surface
reflection.chi_def: （光線、熱量、聲音或能量從表面的）反射
reflection.eg: He put silver foil around the fire to increase heat reflection.

reflection.eng_def: the angle that a beam of light or other energy that is reflected from a surface makes with a line vertical to that surface
a sign or result of something
reflection.eg: The fact that soldiers are on the streets is a reflection of how terrified the government is.
On reflection (= after considering it), I decided I had been wrong.

reflection.eng_def: something that makes other people have a particular opinion about someone or something, especially a bad opinion
reflection.chi_def: 給…帶來（尤指不好的）影響的事情；招致對…非議的事情
reflection.eg: Low test scores are a sad reflection on our school system.

reflective.eng_def: A reflective surface sends back most of the light that shines on it and can therefore be seen easily.

reflective.eg: After hearing the news they sat in a quiet, reflective silence.

reform.eng_def: to make an improvement, especially by changing a person's behaviour or the structure of something
reform.chi_def: （尤指透過改變人的行為或事物的構造而）改革，改進，改造
reform.eg: Who will reform our unfair electoral system?

reform.eng_def: an improvement, especially in a person's behaviour or in the structure of something
reform.chi_def: （尤指人的行為或事物構造方面的）改革，改進，改造，改良
reform.eg: Some reforms of/to the system will be necessary.

refresh.eng_def: to make someone less hot or tired
refresh.chi_def: 使涼爽；使恢復精力；使振作精神
refresh.eg: It was such a hot night that I had a cold shower to refresh myself.

refresh.eng_def: to make the most recent information on an internet page appear, usually by clicking a button on the computer screen
refresh.chi_def: （通常指透過點選電腦螢幕上的按鈕來）刷新，更新（網頁）

refreshment.eg: He stopped at a bar for a little refreshment.

refrigerator.eng_def: a piece of kitchen equipment that uses electricity to preserve food at a cold temperature
refrigerator.eg: Store fruit juice in the refrigerator.

refuge.eng_def: (a place that gives) protection or shelter from danger, trouble, unhappiness, etc.
refuge.eg: These people are seeking/taking refuge from persecution.

refugee.eng_def: a person who has escaped from their own country for political, religious, or economic reasons or because of a war
refugee.eg: Thousands of refugees fled across the border.

refund.eng_def: an amount of money that is given back to you, especially because you are not happy with a product or service that you have bought
refund.chi_def: （尤指因為對購買的産品或服務不滿意而追回的）退款，返還款，償還金額
refund.eg: I took the radio back to the shop and asked for/demanded/got/was given a refund.
When I went on business to Peru, the office refunded my expenses.

refusal.eng_def: the act of refusing to do or accept something
refusal.eg: Our request for permission to travel met with/received a flat/point-blank (= complete) refusal from the authorities.

refuse.eng_def: to say that you will not do or accept something
refuse.eg: He asked me to give him another loan, but I refused.

refuse.eng_def: unwanted waste material, especially material that is regularly thrown away from a house, factory, etc.
refuse.chi_def: （尤指家庭、工廠等固定産生的）廢物，廢料，垃圾

refute.eng_def: to say or prove that a person, statement, opinion, etc. is wrong or false
refute.chi_def: 駁斥；反駁；否認…的正確性（或真實性）

regard.eng_def: to consider or have an opinion about something or someone
regard.eg: Environmentalists regard GM technology with suspicion.

regard.eng_def: to look carefully at something or someone
regard.eg: The bird regarded me with suspicion as I walked up to its nest.
There is no problem as regards the financial arrangements.

regard.eng_def: respect or admiration for someone or something
regard.eg: The company holds her in high regard.
I am writing to you with regard to your letter of 15 March.

regard.chi_def: 在這／那方面；在這／那一點上
regard.eg: The union is the largest in the country and in this/that regard is best placed to serve its members.
Please give/send/convey my regards to your mother if you see her.

regarding.eg: The company is being questioned regarding its employment policy.

regardless.eng_def: despite; not being affected by something
regardless.chi_def: 不管怎樣，無論如何；不管，不顧
regardless.eg: The plan for a new office building went ahead regardless of local opposition.

regime.eng_def: a particular government or a system or method of government
regime.eg: The old corrupt, totalitarian regime was overthrown.

regime.eng_def: a particular way of operating or organizing a business, etc.
regime.chi_def: 組織方法；管理體制；體系
regime.eg: The regime in this office is hard work and more hard work.

regime.chi_def: 生活規則，養生之道（同 regimen）

region.eng_def: a particular area or part of the world, or any of the large official areas into which a country is divided
region.chi_def: 區域，地區；（國家的）行政區

region.eng_def: an area of a country, especially one that has a particular characteristic or is known for something
region.chi_def: （一個國家內）有…特色，以…知名的地區

region.eng_def: a particular part of someone's body
region.eg: He said he had sharp pains in the stomach region/the region of the stomach.
They estimate that the temperature yesterday was (somewhere) in the region of -30°C.

regional.eng_def: relating to or coming from a particular part of a country

register.eng_def: to put information, especially your name, into an official list or record
register.eg: I registered the car in my name.

register.eng_def: to record, show, or express something
register.eg: The Geiger counter registered a dangerous level of radioactivity.

register.eng_def: If something registers, someone realizes it and if someone registers something, they realize it.
register.chi_def: （事物）受到注意，被意識到；（人）注意到，意識到
register.eg: I did mention the address but I'm not sure that it registered (with him).

register.eng_def: If you register a letter or parcel, you send it using a special postal service, so that it will be dealt with in a special way and not be lost.
a book or record containing a list of names
register.eg: Guests write their names in the (hotel) register.

register.eng_def: a book used to record if a child is present at school
register.eg: If a child is absent, the teacher notes it down in the (class) register.

register.eng_def: in school, the period at the start of the morning and afternoon when a teacher records on an official list that children are present
register.chi_def: （老師在上、下午開始時對學生的）點名登記

register.eng_def: the style of language, grammar, and words used for particular situations
register.eg: People chatting at a party will usually be talking in (an) informal register.

register.eng_def: all the notes that a musical instrument or a person's voice can produce, from the highest to the lowest
register.eg: music written mainly for the lower/higher register of the clarinet

register.eng_def: the drawer in a cash register (= a machine which records sales in a shop, and in which money is kept) or the cash register itself
register.eg: Next time you have the register open, could you give me some change?

registration.eng_def: the act of recording a name or information on an official list
the official set of numbers and letters shown on the front and back of a road vehicle
registration.chi_def: （機動車輛的）牌照號碼，登記號碼
registration.eg: Police are looking for a small blue car with the registration number B34-ACS.

regret.eng_def: a feeling of sadness about something sad or wrong or about a mistake that you have made, and a wish that it could have been different and better
regret.eg: I left school at 16, but I've had a great life and I have no regrets.

regret.eng_def: to send a polite message that you cannot go to a party, etc.
regret.chi_def: （因為不能赴會等）（向某人）表示歉意，致歉辭謝
regret.eg: We did have an invitation, but we had to send Graham our regrets.

regret.eng_def: to feel sorry about a situation, especially something sad or wrong or a mistake that you have made
regret.eg: Is there anything you've done in your life that you regret?

regular.chi_def: 頻繁的；經常發生的；經常做的

regular.eng_def: existing or happening repeatedly in a fixed pattern, with equal or similar amounts of space or time between one and the next; even
regular.chi_def: 定時的；固定的；有規律的；規則的；均勻的

regular.eng_def: Someone who is regular empties their bowels often enough, and a woman who is regular always has her period at approximately the same time.
regular.chi_def: （人）大便正常的；（女性）月經正常的
regular.eg: The doctor asked if I was regular/if my bowel movements were regular.
Her regular secretary was off sick for a week.

regular.eng_def: A regular verb, noun, or adjective follows the usual rules in the structure of its various forms.
regular.chi_def: （動詞、名詞或形容詞）規則的，按規則變化的
regular.eg: "Talk" is a regular verb but "be" is not.

regular.eng_def: a normal man who is liked and trusted
an army that exists all the time, or a soldier in such an army
the same on both or all sides
regular.eg: He's very handsome, with regular features and deep brown eyes.
The situation here now is becoming a regular disaster.

regular.eng_def: someone who often goes to a particular event or place, such as a shop or restaurant
regular.eg: He's one of the regulars at the pub.

regular.eng_def: a soldier whose permanent job is being a soldier

regulate.eng_def: to control something, especially by making it work in a particular way
regulate.chi_def: （尤指使按照某種方式運作而）控制，管理，調節，調整
regulate.eg: You can regulate the temperature in the house by adjusting the thermostat.

regulation.eng_def: an official rule or the act of controlling something
regulation.chi_def: 規則，條例，法規；控制，管理

regulation.eng_def: according to the rules or the usual way of doing things
regulation.chi_def: 一般的，普通的；規定的；正規的
regulation.eg: businessmen in their regulation pinstripe suits

rehearsal.eng_def: a time when all the people involved in a play, dance, etc. practise in order to prepare for a performance
rehearsal.eg: They didn't have time for (a) rehearsal before the performance.

rehearse.eng_def: to practise a play, a piece of music, etc. in order to prepare it for public performance
rehearse.eg: The musicians rehearsed (the symphony) for the concert.

rehearse.eng_def: When someone rehearses a story or an argument, they repeat it with all the details.
rehearse.eg: These are arguments that I've heard rehearsed at meetings many times before.

reign.eng_def: to be the king or queen of a country
reign.eg: Queen Victoria reigned over Britain from 1837 to 1901.

reign.eng_def: to be the main feeling or quality in a situation or person
reign.eg: The bomb attacks produced a panic which reigned over the city.

reign.eng_def: the period of time when a king or queen rules a country
a period when a particular person, feeling, or quality is very important or has a strong influence
reign.eg: his successful reign as manager of the team

rein.eng_def: a long, thin piece of material, especially leather, that helps you to control and direct a horse
rein.eg: You pull on both reins to stop or slow a horse, but only the left rein to turn left.

rein.eng_def: a strap that is put around a small child's body or wrist and held at the other end by an adult so that the adult can stop the child running away
rein.chi_def: （領幼兒走路時防止其走失的）安全繩套，保護帶
rein.eg: I always put my son on reins when we go shopping.

reinforce.eg: The pockets on my jeans are reinforced with double stitching.

reinforce.eng_def: If something reinforces an idea or opinion, it provides more proof or support for it and makes it seem true.
reinforce.chi_def: 強化，加深，進一步證實（觀點、看法等）
reinforce.eg: The final technical report into the accident reinforces the findings of initial investigations.

reinforce.eng_def: to provide an army with more soldiers or weapons to make it stronger
reinforce.chi_def: 增援；加強…的力量；給…增強裝備
reinforce.eg: The garrison is to be reinforced with/by another two battalions of soldiers.

reject.eng_def: to refuse to accept, use, or believe something or someone
reject.chi_def: 拒絕接受；拒收；不錄用；不相信
reject.eg: The appeal was rejected by the court.

reject.eng_def: to not give someone the love and attention they want and are expecting from you
reject.chi_def: 拒絕…的求愛；嫌棄；冷落；怠慢
reject.eg: When she was sent to boarding school, she felt as though her parents had rejected her.

reject.eng_def: If your body rejects an organ that has been put in during a medical operation, it fails to accept it and tries to attack and destroy it.
a product that is damaged or not perfectly made
a person who has not been accepted by an organization or by society
reject.chi_def: 被拒絕的人；不合格者；被拒收者
reject.eg: He considered himself to be one of life's rejects.

rejection.eng_def: the act of refusing to accept, use, or believe someone or something
rejection.chi_def: 拒絕；拒收；擯棄；拒絕相信
rejection.eg: The government's rejection of the plans is a setback for us.

rejection.eng_def: a letter, etc. that tells you that you have not been successful in getting a job, a place on a course of study, etc.
rejection.chi_def: （工作或課程申請等的）拒絕信
rejection.eg: I've applied for ten jobs, but I've had ten rejections/rejection letters.

rejection.eng_def: the act of not giving someone the love and attention they want and expect
rejection.eg: He never asked her to marry him out of fear of rejection.

rejoice.eng_def: to feel or show great happiness about something
rejoice.chi_def: 非常高興；深感欣喜；充滿喜悅
rejoice.eg: Everyone rejoiced at the news of his safe return.

relate.eng_def: to find or show the connection between two or more things
relate.eg: We need to explain why these issues are important and relate them to everyday life.

relate.eng_def: to tell a story or describe a series of events
relate.eg: She related the events of the previous week to the police.

relate.eng_def: to be able to understand a situation or someone's feelings because you have experienced something similar yourself
relate.eg: I often wake very early - I'm sure most readers over 50 can relate.

relation.eng_def: the way in which two people or groups of people feel and behave towards each other
relation.chi_def: （人際或團體之間的）關係，聯繫，交往
relation.eg: Relations between him and his new wife are rather strained.

relation.eng_def: the connection or similarity between two things
relation.eg: The relation between the original book and this new film is very faint.
She used the map to discover where she was in relation to her surroundings.
The funeral was attended by friends and relations.

relationship.eng_def: the way in which two things are connected
relationship.eg: Scientists have established the relationship between lung cancer and smoking.

relationship.eng_def: the way in which two or more people feel and behave towards each other
relationship.eg: He has a very good relationship with his uncle.

relationship.eng_def: a close romantic friendship between two people, often a sexual one
relationship.chi_def: 浪漫關係；情愛關係；（常指）性關係
relationship.eg: Have you had any serious relationships in the past year?

relationship.eng_def: a relationship in which you have feelings of love and hate for someone or something
relationship.chi_def: 又愛又恨的關係（或感受）
親屬關係；家屬關係；姻親關係
relationship.eg: The judge asked the witness what the relationship was between her and the victim.

relative.eg: I don't have many blood relatives (= people related to me by birth rather than by marriage).

relative.eng_def: being judged or measured in comparison with something else
relative.eg: We weighed up the relative advantages of driving there or going by train.

relative.eng_def: true to a particular degree when compared with other things
relative.eg: Since I got a job, I've been living in relative comfort (= more comfort than before).

relative.eng_def: If something is relative to something else, it changes according to the speed or level of the other thing.
relative.eg: The amount of petrol a car uses is relative to its speed.

relative.eng_def: If something is relative to a particular subject, it is connected with it.
relative.eg: Are these documents relative to the discussion?

relax.eng_def: to (cause someone to) become less active and more calm and happy, or to (cause a part of the body to) become less stiff
relax.chi_def: （使）放鬆，（使）輕鬆；（使身體部位）鬆弛，放鬆
relax.eg: After work she relaxed with a cup of tea and the newspaper.

relax.eng_def: to make a rule or control less severe
relax.eg: Two weeks after the police relaxed security at the airports, there was a bomb attack.

relaxation.eng_def: a pleasant activity that makes you become calm and less worried
relaxation.eg: Yoga is one of my favourite relaxations.

relaxation.eng_def: the act of making rules or the control of something less severe
relaxation.eg: I cannot allow any relaxation in/of the rules.

relay.eng_def: to repeat something you have heard, or to broadcast a signal, message, or programme on television or radio
relay.eg: I was told the news first and then I relayed it to the others.

relay.eng_def: a group of people who continue an activity that others from the same team or organization have been doing previously
relay.chi_def: 接替的一組人；輪換的一隊人
relay.eg: Relays of workers kept the machines going through the night.

relay.eng_def: a running or swimming race between two or more teams in which each person in the team runs or swims part of the race
a device that reacts to a small change in an electrical current by moving switches or other devices in an electrical circuit

release.eng_def: to give freedom or free movement to someone or something
release.eg: He was released from prison after serving two years of a five-year sentence.

release.eng_def: to move a device from a fixed position to allow it to move freely
release.eg: He released the handbrake and the car jumped forwards.

release.eng_def: to fire a bomb or a missile (= flying weapon), or to allow it to fall
release.eg: The plane released its bombs at 10,000 feet.

release.eng_def: to allow a substance to flow out from somewhere
release.eg: Coal power stations release sulphur dioxide into the atmosphere.

release.eng_def: to express a feeling that you have been trying not to show
release.eg: He punched the pillow in an effort to release his anger.

release.eng_def: to allow something to be shown in public or to be available for use
release.eg: Police have released a picture of the man they want to question.

release.eng_def: If a company releases a film or musical recording, it allows the film to be shown in cinemas, or makes the musical recording available for the public to buy.
release.eg: The band's latest album will be released next week.

release.eng_def: to make a product, for example a book, available for the public to buy, often with a celebration; launch
release.eg: The new edition of the dictionary will be released by the education minister later this month.

release.eng_def: an occasion when someone is allowed to leave prison, etc.
release.eg: Her early release from prison led to a demonstration.

release.eng_def: the act of flowing out from somewhere
release.eg: The accident caused the release of radioactivity into the atmosphere.

release.eng_def: a feeling that you are free from something unpleasant
release.eg: I noticed a release of tension when he left the room.

release.eng_def: the act of making something public or available for use
release.eg: There are strict rules on the release of official information.

release.eng_def: a written statement that gives information to be broadcast or published
release.eg: The company issued a press release announcing the appointment of a new CEO.

release.eng_def: a musical recording that is made available for the public to buy
release.eg: Her latest release, a song about doomed love, she wrote herself.

release.eng_def: If a film is on general release, it is available to be shown in cinemas.
release.eg: The latest Disney film goes on general release next month.

relevant.eng_def: connected with what is happening or being discussed
relevant.chi_def: 有關的；相關聯的；切題的
relevant.eg: Education should be relevant to the child's needs.

relevant.eng_def: correct or suitable for a particular purpose
relevant.eg: plans to make schooling more relevant to life beyond school

reliable.eng_def: Someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or believed because he, she, or it works or behaves well in the way you expect.
reliable.chi_def: 可信賴的；可靠的；真實可信的

reliance.eng_def: the state of depending on or trusting in something or someone
reliance.eg: The region's reliance on tourism is unwise.

relic.eng_def: an object, tradition, or system from the past that continues to exist
relic.eg: During the dig, the archaeological team found some relics from the Stone Age.

relic.eng_def: a part of the body or something that belonged to a holy person
relic.eg: These bones are the relics of a 12th-century saint.

relief.eng_def: a feeling of happiness that something unpleasant has not happened or has ended
relief.chi_def: （不快過後的）寬慰，寬心，輕鬆，解脫
relief.eg: It was such a relief to hear that Marta was found safe and well.

relief.eng_def: food, money, or services that provide help for people in need
a method of raising shapes above a flat surface so that they appear to stand out slightly from it
relief.eg: Coins have pictures on them in relief.

relief.eng_def: a sculpture made from a flat surface in which the forms are raised above the surface

relieve.eng_def: to make an unpleasant feeling, such as pain or worry, less strong
relieve.chi_def: 緩解，減輕，解除（疼痛或擔憂）；使寬心，使寬慰
relieve.eg: She was given a shot of morphine to relieve the pain.

relieve.chi_def: 緩和，緩解（令人不快的局勢）
relieve.eg: New toll roads could help relieve congestion on other routes.

relieve.eng_def: to provide relief for a bad situation or for people in need
relieve.eg: emergency food aid to help relieve the famine

relieve.eng_def: to take the place of someone and continue doing their job or duties
relieve.eg: I'm on duty until 2 p.m. and then Peter is coming to relieve me.

relieve.eng_def: to free a place that has been surrounded by an enemy army by military force
relieve.chi_def: 將（某地從敵人的圍困中）解圍；解救
relieve.eg: An armoured battalion was sent to relieve the besieged town.

relieve.chi_def: 撒尿，排尿（urinate 的禮貌性說法）
relieve.eg: He proceeded to relieve himself against a tree.

religion.eng_def: the belief in and worship of a god or gods, or any such system of belief and worship
an activity that someone is extremely enthusiastic about and does regularly
religion.chi_def: 癡迷的活動；極愛好的活動
religion.eg: Football is a religion for these people.

religious.eng_def: having a strong belief in a god or gods
religious.eg: He's deeply religious and goes to church twice a week.

relish.eng_def: If you relish the idea or thought of something, you feel pleasure that it is going to happen.
relish.eg: She's relishing the prospect of studying in Bologna for six months.

relish.eng_def: a type of sauce that is eaten with food to add flavour to it
the enjoyment you get from doing something
relish.eg: She ate her cake slowly and with relish.

reluctant.eng_def: not willing to do something and therefore slow to do it
reluctant.eg: I was having such a good time I was reluctant to leave.

remain.eng_def: to stay in the same place or in the same condition
remain.chi_def: 停留，留下；保持不變，仍然是
remain.eg: The doctor ordered him to remain in bed for a few days.

remain.eng_def: to continue to exist when other parts or other things no longer exist
remain.eg: After the flood, nothing remained of the village.

remainder.eng_def: the part of something that is left after the other parts have gone, been used, or been taken away
remainder.eg: I ate most of it and gave the remainder to the dog.

remainder.eng_def: in mathematics, the amount that is left when one number cannot be exactly divided by another
to sell a book cheaply because it has not sold well and no more copies of it will be produced
remainder.chi_def: 削價出售（滯銷或剩餘的圖書）
remainder.eg: His autobiography never sold very well and was soon remaindered.

remark.eng_def: to give a spoken statement of an opinion or thought
remark.eg: Dr Johnson once remarked (that) "When a man is tired of London, he is tired of life."

remark.eng_def: something that you say, giving your opinion about something or stating a fact
remark.eg: Her remarks on the employment question led to a heated discussion.

remarkable.eng_def: unusual or special and therefore surprising and worth mentioning
remarkable.chi_def: 非凡的；奇異的；引人注目的
remarkable.eg: Nelson Mandela was a truly remarkable man.

remedy.eng_def: a successful way of curing an illness or dealing with a problem or difficulty
remedy.chi_def: 療法，治療；補救（辦法），糾正（辦法）
remedy.eg: an effective herbal remedy for headaches

remedy.eng_def: a way of solving a problem or ordering someone to make a payment for harm or damage they have caused, using a decision made in a law court
remedy.eg: We have exhausted all possible legal remedies for this injustice.

remedy.eng_def: to do something to correct or improve something that is wrong
remedy.eg: This mistake must be remedied immediately.

remember.eng_def: to be able to bring back a piece of information into your mind, or to keep a piece of information in your memory
remember.chi_def: 記得，記起，回想起；記住，牢記
remember.eg: "Where did you park the car?" "I can't remember."

remember.eng_def: to not forget to do something
remember.chi_def: 記住做；牢記著做；不忘記做
remember.eg: Did you remember to do the shopping?

remember.eng_def: to be kept in people's memories because of a particular action or quality
remember.chi_def: 因…而被記住；因…而名垂青史
remember.eg: She will be remembered for her courage.

remember.eng_def: said when you are talking to someone about something that they used to know but might have forgotten
remember.eg: We went and had tea in that little café - you remember, the one next to the bookshop.

remember.eng_def: to hold a special ceremony to honour a past event or someone who has died
remember.eg: On 11 November, the British remember those who died in the two World Wars.

remember.eng_def: to give a present or money to someone you love or who has provided good service to you
remember.eg: My Granny always remembers me (= sends me a present) on my birthday.

remind.eng_def: to make someone think of something they have forgotten or might have forgotten
remind.eg: Could you remind Paul about dinner on Saturday?

reminder.eng_def: a written or spoken message that reminds someone to do something
reminder.chi_def: （告知該做某事的）通知單，提示信，提醒（的話），提示
reminder.eg: If he forgot to pay his rent, his landlady would send him a reminder.

reminder.eng_def: a person or thing that makes you remember a particular person, event, or situation
reminder.chi_def: 使人想起…的東西；引起對…回憶的人；提醒人…的事物
reminder.eg: Patricia's story is a reminder of how vulnerable women can be in what is still essentially a man's world.

remote.eng_def: far away in distance or time, or not closely related
remote.chi_def: 遠的；遙遠的；久遠的；關係疏遠的

remote.eng_def: A remote area, house, or village is a long way from any towns or cities.
remote computer systems are available to users in another part of a building or in another place, for example through a network
remote.eg: This enables you to get remote access to your email.

remote.chi_def: 絕少的；微小的；微乎其微的

remote.eng_def: not very friendly or showing little interest in other people
remote.chi_def: 不友好的；冷漠的；孤高的
remote.eg: Her manner was remote and cool.

removal.eng_def: the act of taking something or someone away from somewhere or something
removal.chi_def: 移開；拿開；去掉；除去；調動

removal.eng_def: the business of transporting furniture and other possessions when people move to a new home
the act of forcing someone to leave an important position or job
removal.eg: There have been calls for the president's removal.

remove.eng_def: to take something or someone away from somewhere, or off something
remove.chi_def: 移開；拿開；去掉；除去；調動
remove.eg: The men came to remove the rubbish from the backyard.

remove.eng_def: to make a negative feeling disappear
remove.chi_def: 排除，去除，打消（負面情緒）
remove.eg: Hearing your opinion has removed my last doubts/suspicions about her.

remove.eng_def: to force someone to leave an important job or a position of power because they have behaved badly or not in a way you approve of
remove.chi_def: 將…免職；開除；解除（某人的職務）
remove.eg: The company's shareholders have voted to remove the executive board.

renaissance.eng_def: a new growth of activity or interest in something, especially art, literature, or music
renaissance.chi_def: （尤指藝術、文學或音樂的）復興
renaissance.eg: Opera is enjoying a long-awaited renaissance.

renaissance.eng_def: the period of new growth of interest and activity in the areas of art, literature, and ideas in Europe during the 15th and 16th centuries
renaissance.chi_def: （15和16世紀時歐洲，尤指義大利北部的）文藝復興，文藝復興時期

render.eng_def: to cause someone or something to be in a particular state
render.chi_def: 使成為；使變得；使處於某種狀態

render.eng_def: to change words into a different language or form
render.eg: She is rendering the book into English from French.

render.eng_def: to give something such as a service, a personal opinion or expression, or a performance of a song or poem, etc. to people
render.eg: The singers rendered the song with enthusiasm.

render.eng_def: to put a first layer of plaster or cement on a wall
render.chi_def: 粉刷；給（牆壁）抹灰（或水泥）

renew.eng_def: to increase the life of or replace something old
renew.chi_def: 給…展期，延長…的期限；更新，更換
renew.eg: Every year I renew my membership of the sports club.

renowned.eg: The region is renowned for its outstanding natural beauty.

rent.eng_def: a fixed amount of money that you pay regularly for the use of a room, house, car, television, etc. that someone else owns
rent.eg: I pay a higher rent/more rent than the other tenants because my room is bigger.

rent.eng_def: offered by the owner for someone else to use in exchange for money
a large hole torn in a piece of material
rent.eg: There was a large rent in his parachute.

rent.eng_def: to pay or receive a fixed amount of money for the use of a room, house, car, television, etc.
rent.eg: I rented a car from a garage so that I could get about.

rent.eng_def: past simple and past participle of rend old use or literary

rental.eng_def: an arrangement to rent something, or the amount of money that you pay to rent something
rental.chi_def: 出租，租賃，租借；租金，租費
rental.eg: Property rental is quite expensive here.

repair.eng_def: to put something that is damaged, broken, or not working correctly, back into good condition or make it work again
repair.eg: to repair (the surface of) the road

repair.eng_def: If you repair something wrong or harmful that has been done, you do something to make it right.
the act of fixing something that is broken or damaged
repair.eg: My car is in the garage for repairs.

repay.eng_def: to pay back or to reward someone or something
repay.eg: He had to sell his car to repay the bank loan.

repeat.eng_def: to say or tell people something more than once
repeat.eg: Would you mind repeating what you just said?

repeat.eng_def: to happen, or to do something, more than once
repeat.eg: The test must be repeated several times.

repeat.eng_def: to say the same thing again, or the same things again and again
repeat.chi_def: 重複說；翻來覆去地說同樣的事情
repeat.eg: His speech was dreadful - he just kept repeating himself.

repeat.eng_def: a situation in which something happens or is done more than once
repeat.eg: All this is a repeat/a repeat performance of what happened last year.

repeat.eng_def: a television or radio programme that is broadcast again
repeat.eg: There's nothing but repeats on television these days.

repetition.eng_def: the act of doing or saying something again
repetition.eg: His books are full of repetition.

repetition.eng_def: something that happens in the same way as something that happened before
repetition.eg: We want to prevent a repetition of last summer's fires, which destroyed more than 500,000 acres of land.

replace.eng_def: to take the place of something, or to put something or someone in the place of something or someone else
replace.eg: The factory replaced most of its workers with robots.

replace.eng_def: If you replace something broken, damaged, or lost, you provide a new one.
replace.eg: I promised to replace the plate that I'd dropped.

replace.eng_def: to put something back where it was before
replace.eg: The librarian replaced the books correctly on the shelves.

replacement.eng_def: the process of replacing something with something else
replacement.eg: the replacement of existing computer equipment

replacement.eng_def: someone who does a job instead of someone else, or something that you use instead of something else
replacement.eg: The agency sent a replacement for the secretary who resigned.

replacement.eng_def: in sports, a player who is used for part of a game instead of another player

reply.eg: "Where are you going?" I asked. "Home," he replied.

reply.eng_def: to react to an action by someone else
reply.eg: She replied to the threats by going to the police.
I asked why, but he made/gave no reply.

report.eng_def: to give a description of something or information about it to someone
report.eg: We called the insurance company to report the theft.

report.eng_def: to be described by people as being or doing a particular thing although there is no real proof
report.chi_def: （沒有確鑿證據的情況下）傳說，據說，傳聞
report.eg: The storm is reported to have killed five people.

report.eng_def: to make a complaint to a person in authority about something or someone
report.eg: My neighbours reported me to the police for firing my rifle in the garden.

report.eng_def: to go to a place or a person and say that you are there
report.eg: I report for (= am ready for and at) work/duty at 8 a.m. every morning.

report.eng_def: a teacher's written statement to parents about a child's ability and performance at school
a description of an event or situation
stories for which you do not yet have real proof
report.eg: According to reports, ten pupils were expelled.

report.eng_def: the loud noise of a shot
report.eg: We heard the loud/sharp report of a rifle.

reporter.eng_def: a person whose job is to discover information about news events and describe them for a newspaper or magazine or for radio or television

represent.eng_def: to speak, act, or be present officially for another person or people
represent.chi_def: 作為…的代表（或代理人）；作為…的代言人
represent.eg: They chose a famous barrister to represent them in court.

represent.eng_def: to be the Member of Parliament, or of Congress, etc. for a particular area
represent.chi_def: （在議會或國會中等）代表某一地區

represent.eng_def: to be the person from a country, school, etc. that is in a competition
represent.chi_def: 代表（國家，學校等參加比賽）
represent.eg: She was chosen to represent France at the Olympics.

represent.eng_def: to express or complain about something, to a person in authority
represent.eg: We represented our grievances/demands to the boss.

represent.eng_def: to show or describe something or someone
represent.eg: The statue represents St. George killing the dragon.

represent.eng_def: to be a sign or symbol of something
represent.eg: To many people the White House represents the identity of the United States.

represent.eng_def: to be the result of something, or to be something
represent.eg: This book represents ten years of thought and research.

representation.eng_def: a person or organization that speaks, acts, or is present officially for someone else
representation.chi_def: 作為…的代表（或代理人）；作為…的代言人

representation.eng_def: the way that someone or something is shown or described
representation.eg: He gave a talk on the representation of women in 19th-century art.

representation.eng_def: a sign, picture, model, etc. of something
representation.eg: This statue is a representation of Hercules.

representative.eng_def: someone who speaks or does something officially for another person or group of people
representative.eg: The firm has representatives in every major city.

representative.eng_def: someone who has been elected to the US House of Representatives
typical of, or the same as, others in a larger group of people or things
representative.chi_def: 有代表性的；典型的；代表…的
representative.eg: Are your views/opinions representative of all the workers here?

representative.eng_def: A representative system of government is one in which people vote for politicians to represent them.

repress.eng_def: to not allow something, especially feelings, to be expressed
repress.chi_def: 壓抑，壓制，克制（尤指感情）
repress.eg: He repressed a sudden desire to cry.

repress.eng_def: to control what people do, especially by using force

reproduce.eng_def: to produce a copy of something, or to be copied in a production process
reproduce.eg: His work was reproduced on leaflets and magazines.

reproduce.eng_def: to show or do something again
reproduce.eg: The new design unfortunately reproduced some of the problems of the earlier model.

reproduce.eng_def: When living things reproduce, they produce young plants, animals, etc.
reproduce.eg: These plants can reproduce sexually and asexually.

reptile.eng_def: an animal that produces eggs and uses the heat of the sun to keep its blood warm

republic.eng_def: a country without a king or queen, usually governed by elected representatives of the people and a president
republic.chi_def: （通常指由選舉産生的人民代表和總統治理的）共和國，共和政體

republican.eng_def: a supporter of government by elected representatives of the people rather than government by a king or queen
republican.chi_def: 擁護共和政體者；共和主義者

republican.eng_def: a member of the Republican Party in the US
a person who believes that Northern Ireland belongs to the Irish Republic

reputation.eng_def: the opinion that people in general have about someone or something, or how much respect or admiration someone or something receives, based on past behaviour or character
reputation.eg: The company has a worldwide reputation for quality.

request.eng_def: the act of politely or officially asking for something
request.eg: They received hundreds of requests for more information.

request.eng_def: a song or something similar that someone has asked to be included in a show or on the radio
request.eg: The next song is a request from/for Roz in Oxford.

request.eng_def: to ask for something politely or officially
request.eg: We requested that the next meeting be held on a Friday.

require.eng_def: to need something or make something necessary
require.eg: Please call this number if you require any further information.

requirement.eng_def: something that you must do, or something you need
requirement.eg: A good degree is a minimum requirement for many jobs.

rescue.eng_def: to help someone or something out of a dangerous, harmful, or unpleasant situation
rescue.eg: The lifeboat rescued the sailors from the sinking boat.

rescue.eng_def: the act of helping someone out of a dangerous or unpleasant situation
rescue.eg: Lifeboats carry out many rescues every month.

research.eng_def: a detailed study of a subject, especially in order to discover (new) information or reach a (new) understanding
to study a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new information or reach a new understanding
research.eg: She's researching into possible cures for AIDS.

researcher.eng_def: the collection and examination of information about things that people buy or might buy and their feelings about things that they have bought
researcher.eg: Market research shows that demand for small cars will continue to grow.

researcher.eng_def: someone whose job is doing market research

resemblance.eng_def: the fact that two people or things look like each other or are similar in some other way
resemblance.eg: There was a clear family resemblance between all the brothers.

resemble.eng_def: to look like or be like someone or something
resemble.eg: You resemble your mother very closely.

resent.eng_def: to feel angry because you have been forced to accept someone or something that you do not like
resent.eg: She bitterly resented her father's new wife.

reservation.eng_def: an arrangement in which something such as a seat on an aircraft or a table at a restaurant is kept for you
reservation.eg: I'd like to make a table reservation for two people for nine o'clock.

reservation.eng_def: an area of land made available for a particular group of people to live in
reservation.eg: The family lives on a Native American reservation.

reservation.eng_def: an area of land in which wild animals are protected
reservation.chi_def: 野生動物保護區；自然保護區；禁獵區
reservation.eg: He's the chief warden of a big-game reservation.

reservation.eng_def: a doubt or feeling of not being able to agree with or accept something completely
reservation.eg: Workers and employees shared deep reservations about the wisdom of the government's plans for the industry.

reserve.eng_def: to keep something for a particular purpose or time
reserve.chi_def: 把…專門留給；把…留作；保留
reserve.eg: I reserve Mondays for tidying my desk and answering letters.

reserve.eng_def: If you reserve something such as a seat on an aircraft or a table at a restaurant, you arrange for it to be kept for your use.
reserve.eg: I reserved a double room at the Lamb Hotel.

reserve.eng_def: the habit of not showing your feelings or thoughts
reserve.eg: I took her out for a drink and tried to break through her reserve.

reserve.eng_def: the act of keeping something or a supply of something until it is needed, or a supply that you keep
reserve.eg: She keeps a little money in reserve (= for use if and when needed).

reserve.eng_def: an area of land kept in its natural state, especially for wild animals to live in and be protected
reserve.chi_def: （尤指保護野生動物生存的）自然保護區，禁獵區，保護區

reserve.eng_def: in sports, an extra player who is ready to play if needed
reserve.eg: We had two reserves in case anyone was injured.

reserve.eng_def: a football team consisting of players who are not in the first team, but who play in a league against reserve teams from other clubs
reserve.eg: Frank was a prolific scorer for the reserves before he graduated to the first team.

reserve.eng_def: a group of people who are not permanently in the armed forces but are used only if needed
reserve.eg: They will call up the reserves.

reserve.eng_def: a feeling of doubt about someone or something
reserve.eg: I can recommend him to you without reserve.

reserve.eng_def: the lowest amount of money the owners will accept for something being sold, especially at auction (= public sale)
reserve.chi_def: （尤指拍賣中買方定的）底價，保留價格，最低價
reserve.eg: A rare Stradivarius violin failed to reach its reserve price (= no one offered to pay it) when put up for auction on Tuesday.

reservoir.eng_def: a place for storing liquid, especially a natural or artificial lake providing water for a city or other area

reservoir.eg: The universities constitute a reservoir of expert knowledge.

reside.eng_def: to live, have your home, or stay in a place
reside.eg: The family now resides in southern France.

residence.chi_def: （官員等）駐在（某地）的，住在（某地）的
residence.eg: The Queen is in residence at the Palace this week.

residence.eng_def: an author (= writer), poet, or artist who is employed at a school or college, etc. for a short period
residence.chi_def: （學校、大學短期招聘的）駐校作家／詩人／藝術家
到（某地）定居；開始定居在（某地）
residence.eg: She took up residence in Canada.

resident.eng_def: a person who lives or has their home in a place
a doctor who is still training, and who works in a hospital
resident.chi_def: （美國的）高級專科住院實習醫生
resident.eg: She's a first-year resident in oncology at Boston General Hospital.

resident.eng_def: living or staying in a place
used to refer to someone who has a special skill or quality in a group or organization
resident.chi_def: （有特殊技能或品質者）常駐的
resident.eg: She is the university's resident expert on Italian literature.

residential.eng_def: A residential road, area, etc. has only private houses, not offices and factories.
A residential job, position, course, etc. is one for which you live at the same place where you work or study.
residential.chi_def: （為工作或學習而）在某處居住的，寄宿的，住宿在任所的

residential.eng_def: relating to where you live or have lived
residential.eg: You must satisfy the residential qualifications to get a work permit.

resign.eng_def: to give up a job or position by telling your employer that you are leaving
resign.chi_def: 辭職；辭去（職務）；放棄（工作）
resign.eg: He resigned from the company in order to take a more challenging job.

resign.eng_def: In the game of chess, you resign when you cannot see any way to avoid being beaten.
resign.chi_def: （在西洋棋中，當看到沒有任何方法避免被擊敗時）放棄，投子認輸

resignation.eng_def: the act of telling your employer that you are leaving your job
resignation.chi_def: 辭職；辭去（職務）；放棄（工作）
resignation.eg: There have been calls for his resignation.

resignation.eng_def: a sad feeling of accepting something that you do not like because you cannot easily change it
resignation.eg: They received the news with resignation.

resist.eng_def: to fight against something or someone that is attacking you
resist.eg: The soldiers resisted (the enemy attacks) for two days.

resist.eng_def: to refuse to accept or be changed by something
resist.eg: The party leader resisted demands for his resignation.

resist.eng_def: to stop yourself from doing something that you want to do
resist.eg: I can never resist temptation/chocolate/the urge to laugh.

resistance.eng_def: the act of fighting against something that is attacking you, or refusing to accept something
a force that acts to stop the progress of something or make it slower
resistance.eg: The car's speed was reduced by air/wind resistance.

resistance.eng_def: the degree to which a substance prevents the flow of an electric current through it
an organization that secretly fights against an enemy that has taken control of its country
resistance.chi_def: 地下抵抗組織，秘密抵抗組織

resistant.eng_def: not wanting to accept something, especially changes or new ideas
resistant.chi_def: （尤指對變化和新思想）抵制的，阻止的，抗拒的
resistant.eg: Why are you so resistant to change?

resistant.eng_def: not harmed or affected by something
resistant.chi_def: 對…有抵抗能力的；抵抗…的；耐…的

resolute.eng_def: determined in character, action, or ideas
resolute.chi_def: 堅決的；有決心的；堅定的
resolute.eg: Their resolute opposition to new working methods was difficult to overcome.

resolution.eng_def: an official decision that is made after a group or organization has voted
a promise to yourself to do or to not do something
resolution.eg: I made a resolution to give up chocolate.
He showed great resolution in facing the robbers.

resolution.eng_def: the act of solving or ending a problem or difficulty
resolution.eg: a successful resolution to the crisis

resolution.eng_def: the ability of a microscope, or a television or computer screen, to show things clearly and with a lot of detail
resolution.chi_def: （顯微鏡、電視、電腦螢幕等的）清晰度，解析度

resolution.eng_def: the act of separating or being separated into clearly different parts
resolution.eg: the resolution of oil into bitumen and tar

resolve.eng_def: to solve or end a problem or difficulty
resolve.eg: Have you resolved the problem of transport yet?

resolve.eng_def: to make a decision formally or with determination
resolve.eg: She resolved that she would never speak to him again.

resort.eng_def: a place where many people go for rest, sport, or another stated purpose
the fact that you have to do something because there is no other way of achieving something
resort.eg: He got hold of the money legally, without resort to violence.

resource.eng_def: a useful or valuable possession or quality of a country, organization, or person
resource.eg: The country's greatest resource is the dedication of its workers.

resource.chi_def: 機敏；足智多謀（resourcefulness的正式說法）

resource.eng_def: to provide an organization or department with money or equipment
resource.chi_def: 為…提供資源；資助；供給…設備
resource.eg: The school must be properly resourced with musical instruments and audio equipment.

respect.eng_def: admiration felt or shown for someone or something that you believe has good ideas or qualities
respect.eg: I have great/the greatest respect for his ideas, although I don't agree with them.

respect.eng_def: politeness, honour, and care shown towards someone or something that is considered important
respect.eg: You really should treat your parents with more respect.

respect.eng_def: a feeling that something is right or important and you should not attempt to change it or harm it
respect.eg: In their senseless killing of innocent people, the terrorists have shown their lack of respect for human life.

respect.eng_def: the feeling you show when you accept that different customs or cultures are different from your own and behave towards them in a way that would not cause offence
respect.chi_def: （對不同風俗和文化的）尊重，開明
respect.eg: She teaches the students to have respect for different races and appreciate the diversity of other cultures.
Please convey/give my respects to your parents.
This proposal differs from the last one in many important respects/one important respect.

respect.eng_def: to feel or show admiration for someone or something that you believe has good ideas or qualities
respect.eg: I deeply respect David for what he has achieved.

respect.eng_def: to be proud of your own qualities or achievements
to treat something or someone with kindness and care
to accept the importance of someone's rights or customs and to do nothing that would harm them or cause offence
respect.chi_def: （對別人的權利或風俗）尊重，重視，禮待
respect.eg: The agreement will respect the rights of both nations.

respect.eng_def: to accept that something is right or important and not to attempt to change it or harm it
respect.eg: The president pledged to respect the existing frontiers between the two countries.

respect.eng_def: to think that it is important to obey a law or rule
respect.eg: I was always taught to respect the law.

respect.eng_def: to do what someone has asked to have done
respect.chi_def: 尊重（某人）的意願；按（某人）的要求去做
respect.eg: His children respected his last wishes and held a simple funeral for him.

respectable.eng_def: considered to be socially acceptable because of your good character, appearance, or behaviour
respectable.chi_def: 體面的；得體的；值得尊敬的
respectable.eg: a respectable young woman from a good family

respectable.eng_def: A respectable amount or quality is large enough or of a good enough standard to be acceptable.
respectable.chi_def: （數量）足夠的；質量不錯的；相當好的

respectful.eng_def: showing admiration for someone or something
respectful.chi_def: 畢恭畢敬的；表示尊敬的；尊重的
respectful.eg: "We're so pleased to meet you at last," he said in a respectful tone of voice.

respectful.eng_def: showing politeness or honour to someone or something
respectful.chi_def: 恭敬的；按照禮儀的；有禮貌的
respectful.eg: There was a respectful two-minute silence as we remembered the soldiers who had died in the war.

respectful.eng_def: to accept that something is important and not to try to change it or cause offence
respectful.eg: He taught his children to be respectful of other cultures.

respective.eng_def: relating or belonging to each of the separate people or things you have just mentioned
respective.eg: Everyone would go into the hall for assembly and then afterwards we'd go to our respective classes.

respond.eng_def: to say or do something as a reaction to something that has been said or done
respond.chi_def: 回答，作答；回應，作出反應
respond.eg: To every question, he responded "I don't know."

respond.eng_def: If diseases or patients respond to treatment, the treatment begins to cure them.
respond.chi_def: （疾病或病人經治療後）有良好反應，有起色，有好轉
respond.eg: It remains to be seen whether the cancer will respond to treatment.

response.eg: Responses to our advertisement have been disappointing.

response.eng_def: any of the parts sung or said, in some religious ceremonies, by the people in answer to the parts said or sung by the priest
response.chi_def: （宗教禮拜儀式中會衆對牧師的）唱和，應答

responsibility.eng_def: something that it is your job or duty to deal with
responsibility.eg: It's her responsibility to ensure the project finishes on time.

responsibility.eng_def: to be in a position of authority over someone and to have a duty to make certain that particular things are done
to have a duty to work for or help someone who is in a position of authority over you
responsibility.eg: The company says it cannot cut its prices any more because it has a responsibility to its shareholders.

responsibility.eng_def: blame for something that has happened
responsibility.chi_def: 對（尤指壞事）負責任；應對…承擔責任
responsibility.eg: Terrorists have claimed responsibility for (= stated that they caused) yesterday's bomb attack.

responsibility.eng_def: good judgment and the ability to act correctly and make decisions on your own
responsibility.chi_def: 有鑑別能力；明辨是非的能力；負責可靠
responsibility.eg: He has no sense of responsibility.

responsible.eng_def: to have control and authority over something or someone and the duty of taking care of it, him, or her
responsible.eg: Paul is directly responsible for the efficient running of the office.

responsible.eng_def: to be controlled by someone or something
responsible.eg: In Australia, the prime minister and the Cabinet are responsible to the House of Representatives.

responsible.eng_def: to be the person who caused something to happen, especially something bad
responsible.chi_def: 對（尤指壞事）負責任；應對…承擔責任
responsible.eg: Who is responsible for this terrible mess?
He held me personally responsible whenever anything went wrong in the project.

responsible.eng_def: to be in control of yourself so that you can fairly be blamed for your bad actions
responsible.chi_def: 對行為負責；有行爲能力
responsible.eg: The defendant was depressed and therefore not fully responsible for her own actions.

responsible.eng_def: having good judgment and the ability to act correctly and make decisions on your own
responsible.chi_def: 有鑑別能力的；能明辨是非的；負責可靠的

responsible.eng_def: A responsible job or position involves making important decisions or doing important things.

rest.eng_def: to (cause someone or something to) stop doing a particular activity or stop being active for a period of time in order to relax and get back your strength
rest.eg: The doctor told him that he should rest for a few days.

rest.eng_def: to be an actor who does not have any work
rest.chi_def: （演員）沒有接到戲而呆在家裡
rest.eg: Over 90 percent of professional actors are resting at any given time.

rest.eng_def: said by lawyers in a law court when they have finished the explanation of their case
to lie or lean on something, or to put something on something else so that its weight is supported
rest.eg: She rested her head on my shoulder.

rest.eng_def: to remain in a particular state or place
rest.eg: We cannot allow the matter to rest here (= to remain as it is)- further action has to be taken.

rest.eng_def: the other things, people, or parts that remain or that have not been mentioned
rest.chi_def: 剩餘部分；其餘；其餘的人
rest.eg: I've got two bright students, but the rest are average.

rest.eng_def: a period of time in which you relax, do not do anything active, or sleep
rest.eg: After they had carried the piano up the stairs, they stopped for a rest.

rest.eng_def: a period of silence between musical notes, or a symbol that represents this
not doing anything active, or not moving
rest.eg: Her heartbeat is only 55 at rest.

rest.eng_def: used as a polite way to say that someone is dead
rest.eg: Your father was a very troubled man, but he's at rest now.

rest.eng_def: to stop, usually in a particular place
rest.chi_def: （通常在某個地方）停止，停下來，靜止下來
rest.eg: The car hit the kerb, rolled over and came to rest in a ditch.

rest.eng_def: an object that supports the weight of something
rest.eg: I used a pile of books as a rest for my telescope.

restaurant.eng_def: a place where meals are prepared and served to customers

restoration.eng_def: the act or process of returning something to its earlier good condition or position
restoration.eg: The first task following the disaster was the restoration of clean water supplies.

restoration.eng_def: the event in British history when Charles II was made king in 1660 after a period in which there was no king or queen
restoration.chi_def: 王政復辟（1660年查理二世的復辟）

restoration.eng_def: belonging to or popular during the Restoration

restore.eng_def: to return something or someone to an earlier good condition or position
restore.eg: The badly neglected paintings have all been carefully restored.

restore.eng_def: If you restore a quality or ability that someone has not had for a long time, you make it possible for them to have that quality or ability again.
to bring back into use something that has been absent for a period of time
restore.eg: Some people are in favour of restoring capital punishment for murderers.

restore.eng_def: to give something that has been lost or stolen back to the person it belongs to
restore.eg: The painting was restored to its rightful owner.

restrain.eng_def: to control the actions or behaviour of someone by force, especially in order to stop them from doing something, or to limit the growth or force of something
restrain.eg: When he started fighting, it took four police officers to restrain him.

restraint.eg: He showed admirable restraint, and refused to be provoked.

restraint.eng_def: something that limits the freedom of someone or something, or that prevents something from growing or increasing
to keep a violent person in a way that prevents them from moving freely
restraint.chi_def: 限制（某人）的人身自由；對（某人）進行管制
restraint.eg: The two prisoners were kept under restraint while they were transported between prisons.

restrict.eng_def: to limit the movements or actions of someone, or to limit something and reduce its size or prevent it from increasing
restrict.eg: measures to restrict the sale of alcohol

restriction.chi_def: 受（尤指官方）限制的，受約束的

restroom.eng_def: a room with toilets that is in a public place, for example in a restaurant
restroom.chi_def: （公共場所的）盥洗室，洗手間，公共廁所

result.eng_def: something that happens or exists because of something else
result.eg: The road has been widened, but the result is just more traffic.
Profits have declined as a result of the recent drop in sales.
We've spent a lot of money on advertising and we're beginning to see the results.

result.eng_def: the information you get from something such as a scientific experiment or medical test
result.chi_def: （科學實驗或醫學檢查的）結果
result.eg: The results of the opinion poll showed that most women supported this action.

result.eng_def: the mark you receive after you have taken an exam or test
result.eg: I finished my exams yesterday, but I won't know/get the results until August.

result.eng_def: the answer to a calculation in mathematics
result.eg: We used different methods of calculation, but we both got the same result.

result.eng_def: the score or number of votes, showing the success or failure of the people involved, in a sports competition, election, etc.
result.chi_def: （選舉的）結果；（比賽的）成績，比分
result.eg: the results of the local elections

result.eng_def: a win in a sports competition
result.eg: The team needs a result to go through to the semifinals.

result.eng_def: the amount of a company's sales, profit, etc. during a particular period
result.chi_def: （公司在某一階段的銷售、利潤等的）成績
result.eg: Airlines reported significantly better financial results for the first quarter.

result.eng_def: to happen or exist because something else has happened
result.eg: Teachers were not fully prepared for the major changes in the exam system, and chaos resulted.

resume.eng_def: If an activity resumes, or if you resume it, it starts again after a pause.
resume.eg: Normal services will be resumed in the spring.

resume.eng_def: If you resume a place or position that you have left for a period of time, you return to it.
resume.chi_def: 恢復；重新回到，重返（某地或某位置）

resume.eng_def: a short statement of the important details of something
resume.eg: She gave us a brief résumé of the project so far.

resume.eng_def: a short written description of your education, qualifications, previous jobs, and sometimes also your personal interests, that you send to an employer when you are trying to get a job
resume.eg: She sent her résumé to 50 companies, but didn't even get an interview.

retail.eng_def: the activity of selling goods to the public, usually in shops
retail.eg: The job is open to applicants with over two years' experience in retail.

retail.eng_def: to sell goods to the public in shops, on the internet, etc.
retail.eg: The company makes and retails moderately priced sportswear.

retail.eng_def: to be sold at a particular price
retail.chi_def: 以…價格零售，零售價格為…

retain.eng_def: to keep or continue to have something
retain.eg: She has lost her battle to retain control of the company.

retain.eng_def: If a substance retains something, such as heat or water, it continues to hold or contain it.
retain.eg: The sea retains the sun's warmth longer than the land.

retain.eng_def: to get the services of a lawyer by paying them before you need them

retaliate.eng_def: to hurt someone or do something harmful to someone because they have done or said something harmful to you
retaliate.eg: If someone insults you, don't retaliate as it only makes the situation worse.

retire.eng_def: to leave your job or stop working because of old age or ill health
retire.eg: Since retiring from the company, she has done voluntary work for a charity.

retire.eng_def: to stop taking part in a race or competition because of illness or injury
retire.eg: She retired from the competition after pulling a leg muscle.

retire.eng_def: to make someone leave their job, usually at a time when they are near to the age at which theywould normally stop working, or because of illness
retire.chi_def: （通常指在僱員接近退休年齡或生病時）使退職，辭退，使退休
retire.eg: Following the merger, he was retired with a generous pension.

retire.eng_def: to leave a room or group of people and go somewhere quiet or private
retire.eg: After dinner our host said, "Shall we retire to the drawing room?"
It had been a long day, so I retired early.

retirement.eng_def: the act of leaving your job and stopping working, usually because you are old
retirement.eg: Many teachers over the age of 50 are taking early retirement.

retirement.eng_def: the period in someone's life after they have stopped working because of having reached a particular age
retirement.chi_def: 退休生活；退休後的歲月
retirement.eg: We wish you a long and happy retirement.

retort.eng_def: to answer someone quickly in an angry or funny way
a quick answer that is angry or funny
retort.eg: "I'm going to tell him," said Max. "Just you try!" came the retort.

retreat.eng_def: to go away from a place or person in order to escape from fighting or danger
retreat.eg: Attacks by enemy aircraft forced the tanks to retreat (from the city).

retreat.eng_def: to go to a quiet safe place in order to avoid a difficult situation
retreat.eg: When he's done something wrong, he retreats to his bedroom.

retreat.eng_def: to decide not to do something, or to stop believing something, because it causes too many problems
retreat.chi_def: 改變主意；退縮；放棄信仰
retreat.eg: The government is retreating from its promises.

retreat.eng_def: If a price retreats, it goes down after it has gone up.
retreat.eg: Wheat prices retreated after a two-day increase.

retreat.eng_def: a move back by soldiers or an army, either because they have been defeated or in order to avoid fighting
retreat.chi_def: （士兵或軍隊的）撤退，退卻，後退

retreat.eng_def: a period of time used to pray and study quietly, or to think carefully, away from normal activities and duties
retreat.eg: We went on (a) retreat at/to a monastery in Wales.

retreat.eng_def: a change from previous beliefs or behaviour
retreat.eg: The professor's speech marked/signalled a retreat from his usual extreme views.

retreat.eng_def: a situation in which the price of something goes down
retreat.eg: Over the past few weeks we have seen the currency's big retreat from its historic high.

retrieve.eng_def: to find and bring back something
retrieve.eg: We taught our dog to retrieve a ball.

return.eng_def: to come or go back to a previous place
return.eg: Odysseus returned home/returned to his home after many years of travelling.

return.eng_def: If people or things return to a previous condition, they go back to that condition.
return.eg: Within a week, the situation had returned to normal.

return.eng_def: If you return to an activity or subject, you start doing it or talking about it again.
return.eg: Gandhi urged Indians to return to spinning their own yarn.

return.eng_def: to give, do, or get something after something similar has been given or done to you
return.eg: to return an invitation/greeting

return.eng_def: to give a particular amount of profit
return.eg: My investments return a high rate of interest.

return.eng_def: to send, take, give, put, etc. something back to where it came from
return.eg: The new TV broke so they returned it to the shop.

return.eng_def: in sports such as tennis, to hit the ball back to your opponent
to happen again
return.eg: You must go to the doctor if the pain returns.

return.eng_def: to decide and say if you think someone is guilty or not guilty, or what punishment the person will be given in a court of law
return.eg: The jury returned a verdict of not guilty.

return.eng_def: to elect someone to be a member of parliament, or to another political job
return.eg: It was expected that he would be returned as premier.

return.eng_def: an occasion when someone goes or comes back to a place where they were before
return.eg: The whole town came out to celebrate his return (from the war).

return.eng_def: an occasion when you start to do or have something again
return.eg: Some environmentalists argue for a return to a pre-industrial society.

return.eng_def: a ticket for travel to a place and back again
return.eg: A return to Birmingham, please.

return.eng_def: in exchange
return.eg: Some tenants get rent reductions in return for help managing the building.

return.eng_def: the act of giving, doing, or receiving something in exchange for something
return.eg: Several soldiers were wounded in the return of fire.

return.eng_def: the profit that you get from an investment
return.eg: The return on the money we invested was very low.

return.eng_def: an occasion when something starts to happen or be used again
return.chi_def: 重新出現；再度發生；重新利用
return.eg: Will we ever see the return of/a return to comfortable fashion clothes?

return.eng_def: the key on a computer keyboard that you press in order to say that the words or numbers on the screen are correct, or that an instruction should be performed, or in order to move down a line on the screen
return.eg: Press return/the return key twice to leave a blank line.

return.eng_def: the act of giving, putting, or sending something back
return.eg: the return of the stolen goods

return.eng_def: the act of hitting the ball back to your opponent in sports such as tennis
return.chi_def: （網球等運動中的）回擊，回擊球
return.eg: Chang's return of serve was powerful.

return.eng_def: goods that have been taken back to the shop where they were bought by customers because they are damaged or unsuitable
the votes that are returned, or the results of the voting, in an election
return.eg: The election returns produced a confusing picture of gains and losses.

return.eng_def: in the first post collection that leaves after you receive a letter
return.eg: She answered my letter by return.

return.eng_def: The return part of a journey is the part in which you go back to the place where you started.
return.chi_def: （作為旅行一部分的）回程，返程
return.eg: The return journey took longer because the train was rerouted.

reunion.eng_def: a social event for a group of people who have not seen each other for a long time
reunion.eg: We're having a family reunion next week.

reunion.eng_def: a situation when people meet again after they have not seen each other for a long time
reunion.eg: She had a tearful reunion with her parents at the airport.

reveal.eng_def: to make known or show something that is surprising or that was previously secret
reveal.eg: He was jailed for revealing secrets to the Russians.

reveal.eng_def: to allow something to be seen that, until then, had been hidden
reveal.eg: A gap in the clouds revealed the Atlantic far below.

reveal.eng_def: an occasion at the end of a television programme, etc. when something that has been hidden or kept secret until then is shown to the audience
reveal.eg: The final reveal of the new kitchen was a huge success.

revelation.eng_def: the act of making something known that was secret, or a fact that is made known
revelation.chi_def: 暴露；被揭示的真相，被揭露的內情

revelation.eng_def: to be an extremely pleasant surprise
revelation.chi_def: 讓人大開眼界；令人耳目一新；出乎意料地使人驚喜
revelation.eg: This book came as a complete revelation to me.

revenge.eng_def: harm done to someone as a punishment for harm that they have done to someone else
revenge.eg: She took/got/exacted (her) revenge on him for leaving her by smashing up his car.

revenge.eng_def: to harm someone as a punishment for harm that they have done to you

revenue.eng_def: the income that a government or company receives regularly
revenue.chi_def: （政府的）稅收，歲入；（公司的）收益
revenue.eg: Taxes provide most of the government's revenue.

reverse.eng_def: to change the direction, order, position, result, etc. of something to its opposite
reverse.chi_def: （使）反向；（使）倒轉；徹底改變；推翻
reverse.eg: The new manager hoped to reverse the decline in the company's fortunes.
He reversed into a lamppost and damaged the back of the car.

reverse.eng_def: to make a phone call that is paid for by the person receiving it
reverse.chi_def: 打對方付費電話；使受話方付款

reverse.eng_def: the opposite of what has been suggested
reverse.chi_def: 相反的情況（或事物）；對立面
reverse.eg: You might think that people who don't worry about their diet are fatter and more unhealthy; in fact, the reverse is true.

reverse.eng_def: the back of a coin, medal, etc.
reverse.eg: The coin has a royal coat of arms on the reverse.

reverse.eng_def: in the opposite order or way
reverse.eg: To stop the engine, you repeat the same procedures, but in reverse (order).

reverse.eng_def: the method of controlling a vehicle that makes it go backwards
reverse.eg: To go backwards, you must put the car in/into reverse (gear).
They suffered a serious military/political reverse.

review.eng_def: to think or talk about something again, in order to make changes to it or to make a decision about it
review.eg: The committee is reviewing the current arrangement/situation.

review.eng_def: If critics review a book, play, film, etc. they write their opinion of it.
review.eg: I only go to see films that are reviewed favourably.

review.eng_def: When an important person reviews military forces, they formally visitand look at them.
review.eg: The Queen reviewed the troops on her recent visit.

review.eng_def: to study again something you have already learned, in preparation for an exam
review.eg: We're reviewing (algebra) for the test tomorrow.

review.eng_def: the act of considering something again in order to make changes to it, give an opinion of it or study it
review.eg: an annual review of company performance

review.eng_def: a report in a newspaper, magazine, or programme that gives an opinion about a new book, film, etc.
review.eg: Derek writes film/theatre/book reviews for the newspapers.

review.eng_def: a (part of a) newspaper or magazine that has articles on films, books, travel, famous people, etc.
review.chi_def: 評論性報紙；評論雜誌；（報刊的）評論欄目，評論版
review.eg: Could you pass me the review (section of the paper), please?

review.eng_def: a formal military ceremony in which forces are reviewed by an important person
review.eg: Many diplomats attended a naval review to mark the anniversary of the end of the war.

review.eng_def: information or a practice exercise about a subject to be studied
review.eg: Their teacher distributed a review for the exam.

revise.eng_def: to look at or consider again an idea, piece of writing, etc. in order to correct or improve it
revise.eg: His helpfulness today has made me revise my original opinion/impression of him.

revise.eng_def: to study again something you have already learned, in preparation for an exam
revise.eg: We're revising (algebra) for the test tomorrow.

revision.eng_def: a change that is made to something, or the process of doing this
revision.eg: These proposals will need a lot of revision.

revision.eng_def: study of work you have done, in order to prepare for an exam
revision.eg: She did no revision, but she still got a very high mark.

revival.eng_def: the process of becoming more active or popular again
revival.eg: Recently, there has been some revival of (interest in) ancient music.

revival.eng_def: a performance of a play that has not been seen for a long time
revival.eg: We're staging a revival of a 1950s play.

revival.eng_def: a time when interest in religion starts again in a stronger way than before, or a meeting or series of meetings organized to encourage this to happen
revival.chi_def: 宗教覺醒期（人們對宗教的興趣再次激起的一段時間）

revive.eng_def: to come or bring something back to life, health, existence, or use
revive.chi_def: （使）甦醒；（使）復原；（使）復興；（使）重新流行

revolt.eng_def: If a large number of people revolt, they refuse to be controlled or ruled, and take action against authority, often violent action.
revolt.eg: The people revolted against foreign rule and established their own government.

revolt.eng_def: to make someone feel unpleasantly shocked or disgusted
revolt.eg: We were revolted by the dirt and mess in her house.

revolt.eng_def: an attempt to get rid of a government by using violence
revolt.eg: Troops were called in to crush/put down the revolt.

revolution.eng_def: a change in the way a country is governed, usually to a different political system and often using violence or war
revolution.chi_def: （通常指改變政治體制的）革命
revolution.eg: The French Revolution changed France from a monarchy to a republic.

revolution.eng_def: a very important change in the way that people do things

revolution.eg: The revolution of the earth around the sun was proposed by Copernicus.

revolution.eng_def: one complete circular movement of something, for example a wheel
revolution.eg: Engine speed can be measured in revolutions per minute (abbreviation rpm).

revolutionary.eng_def: involved in or relating to a revolution
completely new and having a great effect
revolutionary.chi_def: 革命性的；大變革的；完全創新的

revolutionary.eng_def: someone who tries to cause or take part in a revolution

revolve.eng_def: to move or cause something to move around a central point or line
revolve.eg: The earth revolves around the sun.

reward.eng_def: something given in exchange for good behaviour or good work, etc.
reward.eg: There's a reward for whoever finishes first.

reward.eng_def: an amount of money given to someone who helps the police or who helps to return stolen property to its owner
reward.eg: The police offered a reward for any information about the robbery.
The company rewarded him for his years of service with a grand farewell party and several presents.

rhetoric.eng_def: speech or writing intended to be effective and influence people
rhetoric.eg: How far the president will be able to translate his campaign rhetoric into action remains to be seen.

rhetoric.eng_def: the study of the ways of using language effectively
clever language that sounds good but is not sincere or has no real meaning
rhetoric.eg: In reply to the question, he just produced a lot of empty (= meaningless) rhetoric.

rhinoceros.eng_def: a very large, thick-skinned animal from Africa or Asia that has one or two horns on its nose

rhyme.eng_def: Words that rhyme have the same last sound
a word that has the same last sound as another word
rhyme.eg: Can you think of a rhyme for "orange"?

rhyme.eng_def: a short poem, especially for young children
rhyme.eg: a book of rhymes and songs

rhyme.eng_def: the use of rhymes in poetry
rhyme.chi_def: 在詩中應用同韻詞；押韻
rhyme.eg: This poem is her first attempt at rhyme.

rhyme.eng_def: written as a poem so that the word at the end of a line has the same last sound as a word at the end of another line
rhyme.eg: A lot of modern poetry is not written in rhyme.

rhyme.eng_def: the vowel in the middle of a syllable, and any sounds after it in the syllable
rhyme.chi_def: 一個音節中部的母音以及之後的所有音

rhythm.eng_def: a strong pattern of sounds, words, or musical notes that is used in music, poetry, and dancing
rhythm.chi_def: （音樂、詩歌和舞蹈的）節奏，韻律，節律
rhythm.eg: He beat out a jazz rhythm on the drums.

rhythm.eng_def: a regular movement or pattern of movements
rhythm.chi_def: 規則的運動；（動作的）節奏；律動
rhythm.eg: She was lulled to sleep by the gentle rhythm of the boat in the water.
