rhythm.eng_def: a regular pattern of change, especially one that happens in nature
rhythm.chi_def: （尤指自然界中的）規則變化，規律，節律

rhythmic.eng_def: A rhythmic sound has a regular movement or beat that is repeated.
rhythmic.eg: the rhythmic sound of the train

rib.eng_def: a bone that curves round from your back to your chest
rib.eg: My son broke a rib when he fell off a ladder.

rib.eng_def: a piece of meat taken from this part of an animal
rib.eg: He cooked rib of lamb for Sunday lunch.

rib.eng_def: one of the curved pieces of metal or wood that support the structure of a boat or roof
a method of knitting that makes a pattern of raised parallel lines
rib.chi_def: 凸條花紋織法；羅紋織法

rib.eng_def: to joke and laugh at someone in a friendly way about something
rib.eg: His brothers ribbed him about his new girlfriend.

ribbon.eng_def: a long, narrow strip of material used to tie things together or as a decoration
ribbon.chi_def: （捆紮或裝飾用的）帶子，絲帶，緞帶
ribbon.eg: Sandra often wears a ribbon in her hair.

ribbon.eng_def: a long, narrow piece of something
ribbon.eg: A ribbon of road stretched ahead of us across the desert.

ribbon.eng_def: a small piece of coloured material given to someone in the armed forces to show approval and admiration for their brave actions
the narrow strip of material that contains the ink for a typewriter
ribbon.eg: My typewriter needs a new ribbon.

rice.eng_def: the small seeds of a particular type of grass, cooked, and eaten as food
a grass that produces these seeds and grows in warm wet places
to separate food, especially cooked potatoes, into very small pieces that look like rice by forcing it through small holes in a special tool
rice.chi_def: （尤指將煮熟的馬鈴薯）壓成米粒狀
rice.eg: Peel, boil, and rice the potatoes.

rich.eng_def: having a lot of money or valuable possessions
rich.eg: He's the third richest man in the country.

rich.eng_def: containing a large amount of a valuable natural substance such as coal, oil, or wood
rich.eg: The region is rich in minerals and coal deposits.

rich.eng_def: containing a lot of something good or useful
rich.eg: Pineapple juice is rich in vitamins A and B.

rich.eng_def: Rich land or soil contains a large amount of substances that help plants to grow.
rich.eg: the richest arable land in the country

rich.eng_def: used in compounds to say that someone has a lot of a particular thing, or that something contains a lot of a particular substance
rich.eg: This type of pension plan is popular with business owners or property-rich investors.

rich.eng_def: containing a lot of exciting events or experiences and therefore very interesting
rich.chi_def: 豐富多彩的；閱曆豐富的
rich.eg: He has written a book about the island's rich history.

rich.eng_def: If the style of something such as a piece of furniture or a building is rich, it contains a lot of decoration.
rich.chi_def: 富麗堂皇的；裝飾華麗的
rich.eg: The temple is noted for its rich carvings.

rich.eng_def: A rich colour, sound, smell, or taste is strong in a pleasing or attractive way.
rich.chi_def: （顔色）濃重的；（聲音）渾厚的，圓潤洪亮的；（味道）馥鬱的
rich.eg: This lipstick gives long-lasting rich colour.

rich.eng_def: A rich material is very beautiful and valuable.
rich.eg: She wore a velvet skirt and a rich brocade jacket.

rich.eng_def: If food is rich, it contains a large amount of oil, butter, eggs, or cream.
rich.eg: This chocolate mousse is too rich for me.

rich.eng_def: used to describe someone's opinions when that person has the same bad qualities as the person they are criticizing
rich.eg: The education minister's criticism of the new exam system seems rich, considering it was he who demanded the changes in the first place.

rich.eng_def: rich people considered together as a group
rich.eg: The resort is frequented by the rich and famous.

rich.eng_def: containing a large amount of a valuable substance

riches.eng_def: a large amount of money or valuable possessions
riches.eg: She donated a sizeable portion of her riches to children's charities.

riches.eng_def: a large quantity of a valuable natural substance
riches.chi_def: 豐富的礦產；豐饒的物産；珍貴豐富的自然資源
riches.eg: The country has great oil/mineral riches.

rid.eng_def: to not now have an unwanted or unpleasant task, object, or person
rid.eg: I didn't enjoy marking those papers and I was glad to be rid of them.

rid.eng_def: to remove or throw away something unwanted
rid.eg: That cream got rid of my skin rash.

rid.eng_def: to sell an old or unwanted possession
rid.eg: Have you managed to get rid of your old Volvo yet?

rid.eng_def: to send away someone annoying or to persuade them to leave
rid.eg: We got rid of our unwelcome guests by saying we had to go to bed.

riddle.eng_def: a type of question that describes something in a difficult and confusing way and has a clever or funny answer, often asked as a game
something that is confusing, or a problem that is difficult to solve
riddle.eg: Scientists may have solved the riddle of Saturn's rings.

riddle.eng_def: to make a lot of holes in something
riddle.eg: The anti-aircraft guns riddled the plane's wings with bullets.

ride.eng_def: to sit on something such as a bicycle, motorbike, or horse and travel along on it controlling its movements
ride.eg: I learned to ride a bike when I was six.

ride.eng_def: to travel in a vehicle, such as a car, bus, or train
ride.eg: He doesn't have a car so he rides to work on the bus.

ride.eng_def: to try to control someone and force them to work
ride.chi_def: 駕馭，試圖控制（某人）並強迫其工作
ride.eg: Your boss is riding you much too hard at the moment.

ride.eng_def: a journey on a horse or bicycle, or in a vehicle
ride.chi_def: （騎馬、騎車或乘坐車輛的）旅行，行程
ride.eg: It's a short bus ride to the airport.

ride.eng_def: a free journey in a car to a place where you want to go
ride.eg: He asked me for a ride into town.

ride.eng_def: a person who gives you a ride in their car
ride.eg: Well, I have to go - my ride is here.

ride.eng_def: a machine in an amusement park that people travel in or are moved around by for entertainment
ride.chi_def: （遊樂園裡）供人乘坐的遊樂裝置
ride.eg: We went on all the rides.

ridge.eng_def: a long, narrow raised part of a surface, especially a high edge along a mountain
ridge.eg: We walked along the narrow mountain ridge.

ridge.eng_def: the part of a roof where the sloping sides join at the top

ridicule.eng_def: unkind words or actions that make someone or something look stupid
ridicule.eg: She was treated with scorn and ridicule by her colleagues when she applied for the job.

ridicule.eng_def: to laugh at someone in an unkind way
ridicule.eg: She rarely spoke her mind out of fear of being ridiculed.

ridiculous.eng_def: stupid or unreasonable and deserving to be laughed at
ridiculous.eg: Do I look ridiculous in this hat?

rifle.eng_def: a type of gun with a long barrel (= part shaped like a tube), fired from the shoulder and designed to be accurate at long distances
to search quickly through something, often in order to steal something
rifle.eg: The safe had been rifled and the diamonds were gone.

right.eng_def: correct
right.eg: You got three answers right and two wrong.

right.eng_def: If you are right about something or someone, you are correct in your judgment or statement about it, him, or her.
right.chi_def: （判斷或說法）準確的，確切的，恰當的
right.eg: You were right about Pete - he's a real troublemaker.

right.eng_def: suitable or correct, or as it should be
right.chi_def: 合適的，恰當的；理想的；符合要求的
right.eg: He's the right person for the job.

right.eng_def: used to refer to a person who is considered to be socially important or a place that such people go to
right.chi_def: （人或地方）重要的，顯貴的，顯赫的
right.eg: She knows all the right people.

right.eng_def: in the correct position
right.chi_def: 在正確的位置；不偏不倚
right.eg: The lid has to go on the right way round or it won't fit.

right.eng_def: considered fair or morally acceptable by most people
right.chi_def: 公正的；正當的；符合道德的；正義的
right.eg: I don't believe they should have put him in prison. It isn't right.

right.eng_def: healthy, or working correctly
right.eg: I haven't felt right since I ate that meal last night.

right.eng_def: used for emphasizing when something is bad
right.eg: He's a right idiot.

right.eng_def: on or towards the side of your body that is to the east when you are facing north
right.chi_def: 右邊的，右側的；向右的；在右邊；向右
right.eg: Most people write with their right hand.

right.eng_def: on or towards the side of your body that is to the east when you are facing north
right.eg: Turn/Go right (= take the road on the right) at the first traffic lights.

right.eng_def: exactly or all the way
right.eg: I've got a pimple right on the end of my nose.

right.eng_def: used for emphasis
right.eg: The car ran right (= completely) out of fuel.

right.eng_def: immediately
right.eg: You'd better leave right now.

right.eng_def: at the present time
right.eg: We're very busy right now.

right.eng_def: used as part of the title of particular people, such as bishops and some members of Parliament
right.eg: the Right Honourable Diane Abbott, MP

right.eng_def: correctly
right.eg: Why does he never do anything right?

right.eng_def: If something goes right, it is successful or happens in a way that you hoped it would.
right.eg: Things haven't been going right for me these past few months.

right.eng_def: the right side
right.eg: English is written and read from left to right.

right.eng_def: political parties or people that have traditional opinions, and that believe in low taxes, property, and industry being privately owned, and less help for the poor
right.eg: The right was/were in power after 1979.

right.eng_def: what is considered to be morally good or acceptable
right.eg: Your conscience should tell you the difference between right and wrong.

right.eng_def: If you are in the right, what you are doing is morally or legally correct.
the fact that a person or animal can expect to be treated in a fair, morally acceptable, or legal way, or to have the things that are necessary for life
right.eg: She campaigned for women's rights during the 1960s.

right.eng_def: If you are within your rights to do something, you are legally allowed to do it.
right.chi_def: 在自身合法範圍內；（做某事）是正當的
right.eg: I think I'm quite within my rights to demand a full refund.

right.eng_def: legal controls over who is allowed to use a book or film
right.eg: He has acquired the film rights to the book (= he is allowed to make a film of the book).

right.eng_def: new shares in a particular company that have become available for people to buy who already own shares
right.eg: The company made a rights issue of one new share for every four held.

right.eng_def: to improve or correct something
right.chi_def: 使走上正軌；使恢復正常；糾正
right.eg: The company needs over a million dollars to set its finances to rights.

right.eng_def: used to express agreement with someone or to show that you have understood what someone has said
right.chi_def: （表示同意或聽懂別人說的話）好，行，對
right.eg: "Johnny, you climb up first." "Right."

right.eng_def: said when you want to make a group of people notice you, especially so that you can start an activity
right.chi_def: （尤指為了開始一項活動而引起人們的注意）嗨，喂，好了
right.eg: Right, everyone. Could you all stop talking, and then we'll begin.

right.eng_def: said between parts of a story that you are telling, in order to make certain that people are paying attention and understanding
right.chi_def: （用於講述故事時吸引人注意或者弄清楚聽者是否明白）對吧，哎
right.eg: So there I was right, middle of the night, right, and this guy came up to me...

right.eng_def: If you right a situation or a mistake, you make it better or correct it.
right.eg: It's a terrible situation and we should right it as soon as possible.

right.eng_def: If a boat rights itself, it turns itself back to its correct position in the water.
right.chi_def: 將（船）扶正；使（船）翻轉（到正常位置）
right.eg: The canoe will right itself if it capsizes.

rigid.eng_def: stiff or fixed; not able to be bent or moved
rigid.chi_def: 僵硬的；固定的；不能彎曲的
rigid.eg: a rigid steel and concrete structure

rigid.eng_def: not able to be changed or persuaded
rigid.eg: We were disappointed that they insisted on such a rigid interpretation of the rules.

rigorous.eng_def: careful to look at or consider every part of something to make certain it is correct or safe
controlling behaviour in a severe way
rigorous.eg: the rigorous controls governing the sale of shares

rim.eng_def: the outer, often curved or circular, edge of something
rim.eg: The rim of the cup was chipped and broken.

rim.eng_def: to be round or along the edge of something
rim.chi_def: 環繞（某物的邊緣）；形成…的邊沿；給…鑲邊
rim.eg: The martini glass was rimmed with sugar.

ring.eng_def: a circle of any material, or any group of things or people in a circular shape or arrangement
ring.chi_def: 環（狀物）；圓形的東西；環形排列
ring.eg: The game involved throwing metal rings over a stick.

ring.eng_def: a circular piece of jewellery worn especially on your finger
ring.eg: He bought her a diamond/emerald, etc. ring (= a ring with a jewel attached to it).

ring.eng_def: a group of people who help each other, often secretly and in a way that is to their advantage
a circular piece of material often made of metal that can be heated in order to be used for cooking
a special area where people perform or compete
ring.chi_def: （表演或進行競賽的）表演場，競技場

ring.eng_def: two round handles at the ends of two long ropes that hang from the ceiling and are used in gymnastics
the act of making a phone call to someone
ring.eg: I'll give you a ring tomorrow.
There was a ring at the door.

ring.eng_def: to make a phone call to someone
ring.eg: I ring home once a week to tell my parents I'm okay.

ring.eng_def: to (cause to) make the sound of a bell

ring.eg: Armed police ringed the hijacked plane.

ring.eng_def: to draw a circle around something
ring.eg: Students should ring the correct answers in pencil.

ring.eng_def: to put a ring on something, especially an animal
ring.chi_def: （尤指在動物身上）套環，戴上環套
ring.eg: We ringed the birds (= put rings around their legs) so that we could identify them later.

riot.eng_def: a noisy, violent, and uncontrolled public meeting
riot.eg: Food protests and riots have erupted in more than 30 countries.

riot.eng_def: a very funny or entertaining occasion or person
riot.chi_def: 非常有趣的人（或事物）；令人愉快的場合（或人）
riot.eg: "How was the party?" "It was great - we had a riot."

riot.eng_def: to take part in a riot
riot.eg: Students are rioting in the streets of the capital.

rip.eng_def: to pull apart; to tear or be torn violently and quickly
rip.eg: His new trousers ripped when he bent down.

rip.eng_def: to remove something quickly, without being careful
rip.eg: I wish the old fireplaces hadn't been ripped out.

rip.eng_def: to copy pictures or sounds from a CD or DVD onto a computer
rip.chi_def: （從光碟把圖片或聲音）擷取／複製（至電腦）
rip.eg: How do I rip a DVD movie to my hard drive?

rip.eng_def: a tear in a piece of cloth or paper
rip.eg: Your sleeve has a rip in it.

rip.eng_def: a copy of a CD or DVD that you make on a computer
rip.chi_def: （在電腦上製作的光碟）複製本
（墓碑銘文）願其靈魂安息（rest in peace的縮寫）

ripe.eng_def: (of fruit or crops) completely developed and ready to be collected or eaten
ripe.eg: Those bananas aren't ripe yet - they're still green.

ripe.eng_def: Ripe cheese has developed a strong flavour.
ripe.eg: This brie smells good and ripe.

ripe.eng_def: A ripe smell is strong and unpleasant.
ripe.eg: There was a ripe smell from his socks.

ripe.eng_def: used to describe language that is rude

ripple.eng_def: a small wave on the surface of water
ripple.eg: The stone she threw caused ripples to spread across the lake.

ripple.eng_def: a sound or feeling that spreads through a person or group of people, gradually increasing and then becoming smaller
ripple.chi_def: （聲音的）傳播起伏；（感情的）逐漸擴散
ripple.eg: A ripple of laughter/applause, etc. ran through the crowd.

ripple.eng_def: plain ice cream with thin lines of other flavours in it
to (cause to) move in small waves

rise.eg: The balloon rose gently (up) into the air.
She rose from her chair to welcome us.
My grandfather rises at five every morning to do his exercises.

rise.eng_def: If a river rises somewhere, it first comes out of the ground there.
rise.eg: The River Cam rises in/at a place called Ashwell.
Inflation is rising at/by 2.1 percent a month.

rise.eng_def: When emotions, etc. rise, they start to increase.
rise.eg: Tempers are rising (= people are becoming angry).

rise.eng_def: to become important, successful, or powerful
rise.chi_def: 變得重要（成功或有權力）
rise.eg: After a long career with the company, she has risen to the position of chief executive.

rise.eng_def: If bread or dough (= a soft uncooked mixture used for making bread) rises, it becomes bigger because of the action of yeast (= a fungus used in beer and bread making).
rise.eg: Leave the dough somewhere warm to rise.

rise.eng_def: (of a group of people) to begin to oppose or fight a bad government or ruler
rise.eg: The people rose (up) against the oppressor/tyrant/dictator.

rise.eng_def: If parliament or a court rises, it stops work.

rise.eg: Police say that youth crime is on the rise again.

rise.eng_def: the process of becoming very famous, powerful, or popular
rise.eg: Her rapid rise to fame/power/popularity, etc. meant that she made many enemies.
The castle is built on a slight rise above the town.

risk.eng_def: the possibility of something bad happening
risk.eg: In this business, the risks and the rewards are high.
This wire is a safety/fire risk.
All houses within 100 metres of the seas are at risk of flooding.

risk.eng_def: used to mean that you are responsible for any damage, loss, or difficulty
risk.eg: Drivers are reminded that they leave their cars here at their own risk.

risk.eng_def: to do something that might be dangerous
risk.eg: Don't take any risks - just call the police.

risk.eng_def: to do something although there is a chance of a bad result
risk.eg: "It's dangerous to cross here." "I'll just have to risk it."

risk.eng_def: If you risk something important, you cause it to be in a dangerous situation where you might lose it.
risk.eg: I'm not risking my life (informal neck) in that old car.

rite.eng_def: (a usually religious ceremony with) a set of fixed words and actions

ritual.eng_def: a set of fixed actions and sometimes words performed regularly, especially as part of a ceremony
ritual.chi_def: 例行公事，老規矩；（尤指）儀式
ritual.eg: Coffee and the newspaper are part of my morning ritual.

rival.eng_def: a person, group, etc. competing with others for the same thing or in the same area
rival.eg: He beat his closest/nearest rival by 20 marks.

rival.eng_def: to be as good, clever, beautiful, etc. as someone or something else
rival.eg: No computer can rival a human brain for/in complexity.

rivalry.eng_def: a situation in which people, businesses, etc. compete with each other for the same thing
rivalry.eg: There's such rivalry among/between my three sons.

river.eng_def: a natural wide flow of fresh water across the land into the sea, a lake, or another river
river.eg: We sailed slowly down the river.

river.eng_def: used before or after the name of a river
river.chi_def: （通常用於河流名稱前，有時位於河流名稱後）河

river.eng_def: in the opposite direction to the flow of water in the river
in the same direction as the flow of water in the river

roach.eng_def: a European fish that lives in fresh water
a piece of card or other material used to make the end part of a joint (= cannabis cigarette) or roll-up (= hand-made cigarette), that the smoke is breathed through

road.eng_def: a long, hard surface built for vehicles to travel along
road.eg: We live on a busy/quiet road.

road.eng_def: If a vehicle is on the road, it is working as it should and can be legally used.
road.chi_def: （指汽車狀況良好）可以上路，可以行駛
road.eg: My car was in the garage for a week, but it's now back on the road.

road.eng_def: When you are on the road, you are driving or travelling, usually over a long distance.
road.eg: After two days on the road, they reached the coast.

road.eng_def: If a group of actors or musicians are on the road, they are travelling to different places to perform.
road.eg: Most rock groups spend two or three months a year on the road.

roam.eng_def: to move about or travel, especially without a clear idea of what you are going to do
roam.eg: After the bars close, gangs of youths roam the city streets.

roar.eng_def: to make a long, loud, deep sound
roar.eg: We could hear the lions roaring at the other end of the zoo.

roar.eng_def: If a vehicle or aircraft roars somewhere, it moves there very quickly making a lot of noise.
roar.eg: She looked up as a plane roared overhead.
The lion let out a loud roar.

roast.eng_def: to cook food in an oven or over a fire
roast.eg: Just roast the chicken in the oven and baste it in oil and lemon.

roast.eng_def: to heat nuts or coffee beans so that they become drier and browner
to criticize severely or speak angrily to someone
roast.eg: Critics roasted him for exploiting racial stereotypes.

roast.eng_def: Roast meat or vegetables have been cooked in an oven or over a fire
a large piece of roasted meat

rob.eng_def: to take money or property illegally from a place, organization, or person, often using violence
rob.eg: The terrorists financed themselves by robbing banks.

rob.eng_def: If someone is robbed of something they deserve or want, it is taken away from them.
rob.eg: A last-minute injury robbed me of my place on the team.

robber.eg: The robbers shot a policeman before making their getaway.

robbery.eng_def: the crime of stealing from somewhere or someone
robbery.eg: The gang admitted they had committed four recent bank robberies.

robe.eng_def: a long, loose piece of clothing worn especially on very formal occasions
robe.chi_def: 長袍，罩袍；（尤指特別正式場合穿的）袍服，禮袍
robe.eg: Judges wear black robes when they are in court.

robe.eng_def: a loose piece of clothing that is worn before or after a bath or on top of clothing worn in bed
robe.eg: He wrapped a robe around himself before answering the door.

robin.eng_def: a small, brown European bird with a red front, or a similar but slightly larger brown bird of North America
robin.chi_def: （産於歐洲的）鴝，知更鳥；（産於北美的）旅鶇，美洲知更鳥
robin.eg: Robins mostly appear in the winter and are commonly pictured on Christmas cards.

robot.eng_def: a machine controlled by a computer that is used to perform jobs automatically
robot.eg: The surgery can be carried out by robots.

robot.eng_def: someone who does things in a very effective way but never shows their emotions
robot.chi_def: 像機器一樣的人，機械呆板的人
robot.eg: He played like a robot - note-perfect, but with no expression or dynamics at all.

robust.eng_def: (of a person or animal) strong and healthy, or (of an object or system) strong and unlikely to break or fail
robust.chi_def: （人或動物）強壯的，茁壯的；（東西或系統）堅固的，耐用的，結實的
robust.eg: He looks robust and healthy enough.

rock.eng_def: the dry solid part of the earth's surface, or any large piece of this that sticks up out of the ground or the sea
rock.eg: Mountains and cliffs are formed from rock.

rock.eng_def: a piece of rock or stone
rock.eg: The demonstrators were hurling rocks at the police.

rock.eng_def: a line of large stones sticking up from the sea
rock.eg: The storm forced the ship onto the rocks.

rock.eng_def: slang for a valuable stone used in jewellery, especially a diamond
rock.eg: Have you seen the size of the rock he gave her for their anniversary?

rock.eng_def: a type of popular music with a strong, loud beat that is usually played with electric guitars and drums
to (cause someone or something to) move backwards and forwards or from side to side in a regular way
rock.eg: He picked up the baby and gently rocked her to sleep.

rock.eng_def: If a person or place is rocked by something such as an explosion, the force of it makes the person or place shake.
rock.chi_def: 使劇烈震動；使猛烈搖動
rock.eg: The explosion, which rocked the city, killed 300.

rock.eng_def: If an event rocks a group of people or society, it causes feelings of shock.
rock.eg: The managing director's resignation rocked the whole company.

rock.eng_def: to wear a particular style of clothing, etc. and look good or fashionable
rock.chi_def: 因穿戴而顯得好看（或時髦）
rock.eg: There are celebrities over 40 years old who can still rock a tattoo.

rocket.eng_def: a large cylinder-shaped object that moves very fast by forcing out burning gases, used for space travel or as a weapon
rocket.eg: They launched a rocket to the planet Venus.

rocket.eng_def: a type of firework that flies up into the air before exploding
rocket.chi_def: 焰火；煙花；火箭式空中大煙火

rocket.eng_def: a plant whose long green leaves are used in salads
to rise extremely quickly or make extremely quick progress towards success
rocket.chi_def: 迅速上升；迅速成功，一舉成功
rocket.eg: House prices in the north are rocketing (up).

rocky.eng_def: made of rock and therefore usually rough and difficult to travel along
rocky.chi_def: 岩石構成的，多岩石的；崎嶇難行的
rocky.eg: She scrambled along the rocky path.

rocky.chi_def: 身體搖搖晃晃的；頭暈目眩的
rocky.eg: After two months in a hospital bed, I felt a bit rocky on my feet.

rocky.eng_def: uncertain and difficult and not likely to last long
rocky.chi_def: 不穩定的；不牢靠的；動搖不定的
rocky.eg: Their relationship got off to a rocky start.

rod.eng_def: a long, thin pole made of wood or metal
rod.eg: He was given a fishing rod for his birthday.

role.eng_def: the position or purpose that someone or something has in a situation, organization, society, or relationship
role.eg: What is his role in this project?

role.eng_def: an actor's part in a film or play
role.eg: She's got a leading/supporting role in the school play.

roll.eng_def: to (cause something to) move somewhere by turning over and over or from side to side
roll.eg: The vase rolled off the edge of the table and smashed.

roll.eng_def: to move somewhere easily and without sudden movements
roll.eg: A tear rolled down his cheek.

roll.eng_def: If an aircraft or a ship rolls, it leans to one side and then to the other because of the wind or waves.
roll.chi_def: （船或飛機因為風或浪而）搖晃，搖擺

roll.eng_def: If a machine is rolling, it is operating.
roll.eg: Just as the television cameras started rolling, it began to pour down with rain.

roll.eng_def: If you roll your eyes, you move them so that you are looking up, to show that you consider someone or something stupid or silly.
roll.chi_def: （表示認為某人或某事很愚蠢）翻（白眼），向上翻動（眼球）
roll.eg: When he suggested they should buy a new car, she rolled her eyes in disbelief.

roll.eng_def: to (cause something to) turn over onto itself to form the shape of a ball or a tube
roll.eg: He rolled the clay into a ball in his hands.

roll.eng_def: to make a cigarette by wrapping a piece of paper around some tobacco
to fold over a piece of clothing or material to make it shorter
roll.eg: We rolled back the carpet to see the floorboards.

roll.eng_def: to make something smooth and flat
roll.eg: She borrowed a garden roller to roll the grass flat.

roll.eng_def: to make a continuous, repeated, deep sound
roll.chi_def: 發出持續而低沉的聲音，隆隆作響，轟轟響
roll.eg: The drums rolled as the acrobat walked along the tightrope.

roll.eng_def: If you roll your r's, you pronounce them with your tongue moving quickly and repeatedly against the top of the mouth.
roll.eg: When you speak Spanish you roll your r's.

roll.eng_def: a piece of film, paper, or cloth that is rolled into the shape of a tube
If a person or animal has rolls of fat on their body, he, she, or it is very fat.
roll.chi_def: （人或動物身上由於肥胖而突起的）贅肉，肥肉
roll.eg: The dog had rolls of fat along its neck.

roll.eng_def: a small loaf of bread for one person
roll.eg: Would you like a roll and butter with your soup?

roll.eng_def: an official list of names
roll.eg: Is your name on the electoral roll (= the list of people who can vote)?

roll.eng_def: If you take/call the roll, you read aloud the names of all the people on the list to make certain that they are present.
roll.eg: The teacher called the roll to see if any students were absent.

roll.eng_def: an act of rolling on the ground
roll.eg: The dog went for a roll in the grass.

roll.eng_def: sexual activity that is quick and enjoyable and does not involve serious feelings
roll.chi_def: 苟合；野合（快速、享樂的性行為，不涉及認真的感情）
roll.eg: I wouldn't sacrifice my marriage for a roll in the hay with a waitress.

roll.eng_def: The roll of a ship or aircraft is its movement from side to side in the water or air.
a continuous repeated deep sound
roll.chi_def: 發出持續而低沈的聲音，隆隆作響，轟轟響

romance.eng_def: a close, usually short relationship of love between two people
romance.chi_def: （通常短暫的）戀愛關係，羅曼史，風流韻事
romance.eg: They got married last year after a whirlwind (= very short and unexpected) romance.

romance.eng_def: the feelings and behaviour of two people who are in a loving and sexual relationship with each other
romance.eg: I felt as though all the romance had gone out of my marriage.

romance.eng_def: the feeling of excitement or mystery that you have from a particular experience or event
romance.eg: He loves the romance of travelling on a steam train.

romance.eng_def: a story of exciting events, especially one written or set in the past
romance.chi_def: （尤指舊時創作或以古代為背景的）傳奇故事

romance.eng_def: to tell stories that are not true, or to describe an event in a way that makes it sound better than it was
to try to persuade someone to love you

romance.eg: French, Italian, and Spanish are all Romance languages.

romantic.eng_def: relating to love or a close loving relationship
exciting and mysterious and having a strong effect on your emotions
romantic.chi_def: 富於浪漫色彩的；充滿傳奇色彩的；驚險的
romantic.eg: We thought that Egypt was an incredibly romantic country.

romantic.eng_def: not practical and having a lot of ideas that are not related to real life
romantic.chi_def: 不切實際的；空想的；幻想的
romantic.eg: She has a romantic idea of what it's like to be a struggling young artist.

romantic.eng_def: someone who is not practical and has ideas that are not related to real life
romantic.chi_def: 耽於幻想的人；滿腦子浪漫想法的人；浪漫主義者

roof.eng_def: the covering that forms the top of a building, vehicle, etc.
roof.eg: The house has a sloping/flat/tiled/thatched roof.

roof.eng_def: to put a roof on a building
roof.chi_def: 給（建築物）蓋屋頂；給（建築物）裝屋頂

room.eng_def: a part of the inside of a building that is separated from other parts by walls, floor, and ceiling
room.eg: I like this room - it has plenty of light.

room.eng_def: used as a combining form in the names of particular rooms
a set of rented rooms, especially in a college or university
room.chi_def: （尤指大學中租住的）一套房間，住所，寓所

room.eng_def: the amount of space that someone or something needs
room.eg: That sofa would take up too much room in the flat.
I feel the company has little room for/to manoeuvre.

room.eng_def: to rent a room from someone, or share a rented room with someone
room.eg: At college he rooms with this guy from Nebraska.

root.eng_def: the part of a plant that grows down into the earth to get water and food and holds the plant firm in the ground
the cause or origin of something bad
root.eg: We must get to the root of (= discover the cause of) this problem.
The city of Tours can trace its roots back to Roman times.

root.eng_def: the part of a hair, tooth, or nail that is under the skin
The root of a word is its most basic form, to which other parts, such as affixes, can be added.
root.eg: The root of the word "sitting" is "sit".

root.eng_def: a solution of some equations (= mathematical statements)
A root of a particular number is another number that, when multiplied by itself one or more times, reaches that number.
root.eg: The square root of 64 is 8, and the cube root of 64 is 4.

root.eng_def: to look for something by turning things over
root.eg: She rooted through/among the papers on her desk.
The trees failed to root and so died.

rope.eng_def: (a piece of) strong, thick string made of long twisted threads
rope.eg: A sailor threw a rope ashore and we tied the boat to a post.

rope.eng_def: several of one type of object connected together on a string
thick rope which surrounds an area used for boxing (= sport in which two people hit each other) or wrestling
rope.chi_def: 圍繩（圍繞拳擊或摔跤場所的粗繩）
rope.eg: The middleweight boxing champion had his opponent up against the ropes.

rope.eng_def: to tie things together with rope
rope.eg: I'll rope my horse to your car and pull you out of the ditch.

rose.eng_def: a garden plant with thorns on its stems and pleasant-smelling flowers, or a flower from this plant
a circular object with small holes in it that is put on the end of a watering can (= a container used for pouring water on plants)

rose.eg: The houses were painted various shades of rose.

rot.eg: The fruit had been left to rot on the trees.
Rot has got into the furniture.

rotate.eng_def: to turn or cause something to turn in a circle, especially around a fixed point
rotate.chi_def: （尤指圍繞一個固定點）（使）旋轉，（使）轉動
rotate.eg: Rotate the handle by 180° to open the door.

rotate.eng_def: If a job rotates or if a group of people rotate their jobs, the jobs are done at different times by different people.
When farmers rotate crops, they regularly change which crops they grow in a particular field.

rotation.eng_def: movement in a circle around a fixed point
rotation.chi_def: （尤指圍繞一個固定點）旋轉，轉動

rotation.eng_def: a complete circular movement around a fixed point
rotation.eg: The earth completes 366 rotations about its axis in every leap year.

rotation.eng_def: the act by farmers of regularly changing which crops they grow in a field
rotation.chi_def: 輪作；輪耕（農民有規律地改變田裡種植的農作物）

rotation.eng_def: the act of different people doing the same job at different times
rotation.chi_def: 輪班（不同的人在不同的時間做相同的工作）
rotation.eg: the rotation of key positions such as that of chairman

rotten.eg: The room smelled of rotten vegetables.

rotten.chi_def: 極差的，糟糕透頂的，惡劣的

rough.eng_def: not even or smooth, often because of being in bad condition
rough.chi_def: 高低不平的；崎嶇的；難行的
rough.eg: It was a rough mountain road, full of stones and huge holes.

rough.eng_def: If a surface such as paper or skin is rough, it does not feel smooth when you touch it.
rough.chi_def: （表面）粗糙的，毛糙的，不平滑的
rough.eg: My hands get very rough in the cold.

rough.eng_def: Rough ground is ground that is not used for any particular purpose, is not even, and is full of wild plants.
rough.chi_def: （土地）未開墾的，雜草叢生的，荒的

rough.eg: The builder did a rough sketch of how the new stairs would look.

rough.eng_def: used to describe an alcoholic drink, especially wine, that tastes cheap and often strong
rough.chi_def: （尤指酒類飲料）澀味的，辣嗓子的，劣質的

rough.eng_def: not made in a careful or expensive way
rough.chi_def: 粗製濫造的；簡陋的；粗糙的
rough.eg: I made a rough table out of some old boxes.

rough.eng_def: A rough voice or sound is hard and loud.
If a machine sounds rough, it is making a noise because it is in bad condition.
rough.chi_def: （機器狀況不佳而）發出刺耳聲音的，發出雜音的
粗暴的，粗野的；猛烈的；充斥暴力的，危險的

rough.eng_def: (of the weather or the sea) having strong winds or big waves
rough.eg: I'm always seasick if the water/wind/sea/weather is rough.

rough.chi_def: 艱難的；艱苦的；令人不快的
rough.eg: He's had a rough time/month/year, what with the divorce and then his father dying.

rough.chi_def: 不舒服的，不適的，生病的
rough.eg: You look a bit rough - how much did you have to drink last night?

rough.eng_def: to live temporarily in basic and uncomfortable conditions
rough.chi_def: （暫時）將就度日，因陋就簡地生活
rough.eg: While the house was being decorated we roughed it in a tent.

rough.eng_def: a first quick drawing of something

rough.eg: His first plans were drawn up in rough.
a gang of drunken young roughs

rough.eng_def: in golf, an area of ground with long grass
rough.chi_def: （高爾夫球場的）生有長草的起伏地面，深草區
rough.eg: My ball landed in the rough.
The local team had a bad reputation for playing rough.

rough.eng_def: to live outside not in a house, and sleep on the ground
rough.eg: When we ran out of money, we slept rough for a week.

roughly.eg: There has been an increase of roughly 2.25 million.

roughly.eng_def: without taking a lot of care to make something perfect
roughly.chi_def: 粗糙地；不精細地；簡單地

roughly.eng_def: in a violent or angry way
roughly.eg: He pushed the children roughly to one side.

round.eng_def: in a circular direction or position; around
round.eg: The moon goes round the earth.

round.eng_def: in every part of a place, or in various parts of a place
round.eg: The landlord showed me round (the house).

round.eng_def: on all or some sides of something

round.eg: The garden is round the back (of the house).

round.eng_def: shaped like a ball or circle, or curved
round.eg: Tennis balls and oranges are round.

round.eng_def: (of a number) whole or complete; given to the nearest 1, 10, 100, etc. and not as exact amounts
round.chi_def: 整數的；用整數表示的；用約整數表示的
round.eg: 2.8 to the nearest round number is 3.

round.eng_def: a number of things or group of events
round.chi_def: 一連串的事情；一系列的事件；一系列活動
round.eg: Russia and America will hold another round of talks next month.

round.eng_def: drinks that you buy for a group of people
round.chi_def: （某人給大家買的）每人一份（飲料），一巡（飲料）
round.eg: It's your turn to buy a round.

round.eng_def: a single slice of toast, or a sandwich
a set of regular visits that you make to a number of places or people, especially in order to take products as part of your job
round.chi_def: （尤指作為送貨工作的）例行拜訪

round.eng_def: a song for several singers, who begin singing one after the other at various points in the song

round.eg: She was knocked out of the championship in the third round.

round.eng_def: one of the periods of time during a boxing or wrestling match when the competitors are fighting

round.chi_def: （高爾夫球比賽打完場中所有洞的）一場

round.eng_def: a bullet or other single piece of ammunition
round.eg: The soldiers had only 20 rounds left.
Colin rounded the corner at high speed.

round.eng_def: to move around and past another player while keeping the ball
round.eg: He rounded the keeper and scored.

route.eng_def: a particular way or direction between places
route.eg: The route we had planned took us right across Greece.
A college education is often the best route to a good job.

route.eng_def: a set of regular visits that you make to a number of places or people, especially in order to take products as part of your job
route.chi_def: （尤指作為送貨工作的）例行拜訪，固定路線遞送

route.eng_def: in the US, used as part of the name of numbered roads
route.chi_def: （用於美國城市間幹線公路編號前）公路

route.eng_def: to send something somewhere using a particular way or direction
route.eg: Deliveries are routed via/by way of London.

route.eng_def: to send information from one computer network to another
route.eg: When a customer buys, the purchase order is routed via the internet to each supplier's personal Web page.

routine.eng_def: a usual or fixed way of doing things
routine.eg: There's no set/fixed routine at work - every day is different.

routine.eng_def: a regular series of movements, jokes, or similar things used in a performance
routine.chi_def: （表演中）一套固定的動作，固定的一套噱頭．固定的表演節目

routine.eng_def: a part of a computer program that does a particular operation
done as part of what usually happens, and not for any special reason
ordinary and not special or unusual

routine.eg: My job is so routine and boring - I hate it.

row.eng_def: a line of things, people, animals, etc. arranged next to each other
a line of houses joined together along their side walls
used in the names of some roads
row.chi_def: （用於一些道路的名稱中）路，街

row.eng_def: one after another without a break
row.eg: She's been voted Best Actress three years in a row.

row.eng_def: the activity of making a boat move through water using oars (= poles with flat ends)
row.eg: They've gone for a row to the island.

row.eng_def: to cause a boat to move through water by pushing against the water with oars (= poles with flat ends)
row.eg: The wind dropped, so we had to row (the boat) back home.
My parents often have rows, but my dad does most of the shouting.
I can't concentrate because of the row the builders are making.
My parents are always rowing (about/over money).

royal.eng_def: belonging or connected to a king or queen or a member of their family
good or excellent, as if intended for or typical of royalty
royal.chi_def: 很好的；第一流的；似君王的
royal.eg: The team was given a royal reception/welcome.

royal.eng_def: a member of the royal family
royal.eg: The press follow the royals everywhere.

royalty.eng_def: the people who belong to the family of a king and queen
royalty.eg: She believes she's related to royalty.

royalty.eng_def: a payment made to writers, people who have invented things, owners of property, etc. every time their books, devices, land, etc. are bought or used by others
royalty.chi_def: （專利）使用費；（著作的）版稅；（土地等的）開採使用費，租用費

rub.eng_def: to press or be pressed against something with a circular or up-and-down repeated movement
rub.eg: She yawned and rubbed her eyes sleepily.
He gave her hair a good rub to dry it.

rubber.eng_def: an elastic substance (= that stretches) made either from the juice of particular tropical trees or artificially
rubber.eg: Tyres are almost always made of rubber.

rubber.chi_def: （雨雪天套在鞋上防水的橡膠）套鞋

rubber.eng_def: a series of three or five games between two teams, especially in card games or cricket
rubber.chi_def: 多輪決勝負的比賽（尤指撲克牌或板球三局兩勝或五局三勝）
rubber.eg: We played a rubber of bridge.

rubbish.eng_def: waste material or things that are no longer wanted or needed
rubbish.eg: I forgot to put the rubbish out this morning.

rubbish.eng_def: something that you think is very low quality or not true
rubbish.chi_def: 粗製濫造的東西，劣質的東西；廢話，瞎說

rubbish.eg: Why does everyone rubbish my ideas?

rubbish.eng_def: completely without skill at a particular activity

ruby.eng_def: a transparent, dark red precious stone, often used in jewellery
ruby.eg: a ring with a large ruby

rude.chi_def: 不禮貌的；粗魯的，粗野的；討厭的

rude.eng_def: relating to sex or going to the toilet

rude.chi_def: 突如其來的；突兀的；令人不知所措的；猛烈的
rude.eg: We had a rude awakening (= unpleasant shock) when we saw our phone bill.
We built a rude shelter from rocks on the beach.

rug.eng_def: a piece of thick heavy cloth smaller than a carpet, used for covering the floor or for decoration
rug.eg: My dog loves lying on the rug in front of the fire.

rug.eng_def: a soft cover that keeps you warm or comfortable

rugged.eng_def: (of land) wild and not even; not easy to travel over
rugged.chi_def: （土地）荒蕪崎嶇的；崎嶇難行的
堅固的；耐用的；結實的；簡單皮實的
rugged.eg: Jeeps are rugged vehicles, designed for rough conditions.

rugged.eng_def: If a man's face is rugged, it is strongly and attractively formed.
rugged.chi_def: 相貌粗獷的；強壯英俊的
rugged.eg: She fell for his rugged good looks.

ruin.eng_def: to spoil or destroy something completely
ruin.eg: Huge modern hotels have ruined this once unspoilt coastline.

ruin.eng_def: to cause a person or company to lose all their money or their good reputation
ruin.chi_def: 使破産；使身敗名裂；毀滅
ruin.eg: Cheap imported goods are ruining many businesses.

ruin.eng_def: the process or state of being spoiled or destroyed
ruin.eg: The car accident meant the ruin of all her hopes.

ruin.eng_def: a situation in which a person or company has lost all their money or their reputation
ruin.eg: Many companies are on the edge/brink/verge of ruin.

ruin.eng_def: the broken parts that are left from an old building or town
ruin.chi_def: 廢墟；殘垣斷壁；倒塌的建築物

ruin.eng_def: (of a building or city) to be extremely badly damaged so that most of it has fallen down
ruin.chi_def: （建築物或城市）淪為一片廢墟，成為一片殘垣斷壁
ruin.eg: The town lay in ruins after years of bombing.

ruin.eng_def: to be in an extremely bad state
ruin.chi_def: 完全毀壞；嚴重受損；垮掉
ruin.eg: The economy was in ruins after the war.

rule.eng_def: an accepted principle or instruction that states the way things are or should be done, and tells you what you are allowed or are not allowed to do
rule.eg: A referee must know all the rules of the game.

rule.eng_def: a period of time during which a particular person or group is in control of a country
rule.eg: The period of Fascist rule is one people try to forget.

rule.eng_def: to control or be the person in charge of something such as a country
rule.eg: Most modern kings and queens rule (their countries) only in a formal way, without real power.

rule.eng_def: to be the most important and controlling influence on someone
rule.eg: Love ruled supreme in her heart.
Only the Appeal Court can rule on this point.

rule.eng_def: to draw a straight line using something that has a straight edge
rule.eg: She ruled two red lines under the title.

ruler.eg: The country was without a ruler after the queen died.

ruler.eng_def: a long, narrow, flat piece of plastic, metal, or wood with straight edges where centimetres or inches, or both are printed. It is used for measuring things and for drawing straight lines.

rumble.eng_def: to make a continuous low sound
rumble.chi_def: 發出隆隆聲；發出轆轆聲；發出低沈連續的響聲
rumble.eg: Please excuse my stomach rumbling - I haven't eaten all day.

rumble.eng_def: to discover the true facts about someone or something secret and often illegal
rumble.chi_def: 發現，察覺，看穿（某人的秘密或非法事情的真相）
rumble.eg: His boss eventually rumbled him, and he was sacked.

rumble.eng_def: to take part in a physical fight

rumor.eng_def: an unofficial interesting story or piece of news that might be true or invented, and quickly spreads from person to person
rumor.eg: Rumours are going round (the school) about Mr Mason and his assistant.

rumor.chi_def: 大家都說，據謠傳說，有傳言說
rumor.eg: Rumour has it (that) you're going to be the next managing director. Is it true?

run.eng_def: (of people and some animals) to move along, faster than walking, by taking quick steps in which each foot is lifted before the next foot touches the ground
run.eg: The children had to run to keep up with their father.

run.eng_def: If you run an animal in a race, you cause it to take part.
run.chi_def: 使（狗、馬等）參加比賽；賽（狗、馬等）
run.eg: Thompson Stables are running three horses in the next race.

run.eng_def: to go quickly or in a hurry
run.chi_def: 趕快；迅速趕往；匆忙跑（到某地方）
run.eg: Would you run to the post office and get me some stamps?

run.eng_def: to run fast in order to get or avoid something
run.chi_def: 奔跑追趕；趕搶；快跑躲避
run.eg: I ran for the bus but it drove off.

run.eng_def: to move your legs as if running, while you stay in one place
run.eg: I run on the spot to warm up before I start training.

run.eng_def: to (cause something to) travel, move, or continue in a particular way
run.chi_def: （使）行進，（使）行駛，（使）移動；（使）持續
run.eg: Trains are still running, despite the snow.

run.eng_def: to (cause something to) operate
run.eg: Keep clear of the machines while they're running.

run.eng_def: to be in control of something
run.eg: He's been running a restaurant/his own company since he left school.

run.eng_def: to control a business or other organization firmly and effectively
run.chi_def: 牢牢控制，有效地嚴格管理
run.eg: Ruth runs a tight ship and has no time for shirkers.

run.eng_def: If you run a car, you own one, drive it, and pay for the costs.
run.eg: I can't afford to run a car.

run.eng_def: to organize the way you live or work
run.eg: Some people run their lives according to the movements of the stars.

run.eng_def: to (cause something to) flow or produce liquid
run.chi_def: （使）流動；（使）流出；（使）排出；（尤指衣服的顔色）褪色，擴散，滲色
run.eg: I can feel trickles of sweat running down my neck.

run.eng_def: to be or become
run.eg: Differences between the two sides run deep (= are serious).

run.eng_def: If tights (= thin clothing that covers the legs) run, a long, thin hole appears in them.
run.chi_def: （連褲襪或長筒襪上的）脫線，抽絲
run.eg: Oh no, my tights have run!

run.eng_def: to show something in a newspaper or magazine, on television, etc.
run.eg: All the newspapers ran (= printed) stories about the new peace talks.

run.eng_def: to compete as a candidate in an election
run.eg: Mrs Thatcher wanted to run a fourth time.

run.eng_def: to take guns or drugs illegally from one place to another
run.chi_def: 走私，非法攜帶（槍支或毒品）
run.eg: He was arrested for running drugs across the border into America.

run.eng_def: the action of running, especially for exercise
run.chi_def: 跑，奔跑；（尤指為了鍛煉而進行的）跑步
run.eg: We go for/do a three-mile run every evening after work.

run.eng_def: a journey
run.eg: The number of aircraft on the New York-Moscow run is being increased.

run.eng_def: the period during which a play is performed
run.eg: The musical's London run was a disaster.

run.eng_def: a situation in which many people suddenly buy a particular product
run.eg: There's been a run on umbrellas because of all this rain.

run.eng_def: a situation in which many people suddenly sell a particular product
run.eg: A sudden run on the dollar has lowered its value.

run.eng_def: A run of something is a continuous period during which it lasts or is repeated.
run.eg: a run of successes/defeats/bad luck

run.eng_def: the usual type of something
run.eg: Their food is the general run of hotel cooking.

run.eng_def: an area of ground of limited size for keeping animals
run.eg: a sheep/chicken/hen run

run.eng_def: in cricket and baseball, a single point, scored by running from one place to another
run.eg: England need 105 runs to win the game.

run.eng_def: a long, vertical hole in tights and stockings
run.chi_def: （連褲襪或長筒襪上的）脫線，抽絲
run.eg: I've got a run in my tights from the nail on my chair.

run.eng_def: a condition of the bowels in which the contents are passed out of the body too often and in a form that is too liquid

runner.eng_def: someone who runs, especially in competitions
runner.chi_def: 奔跑的人；（尤指）參加賽跑的人

runner.eng_def: a horse running in a race
a person who works for someone by taking messages, collecting money, etc.

runner.chi_def: 橡膠底帆布鞋，體操鞋（同 running shoe）

runner.eng_def: one of two metal blades under a sledge, usually made of metal, that allow it to move along easily
a long stem of a plant that grows along the ground in order to put down roots in a new place
someone who takes illegal drugs or weapons from one place to another
runner.chi_def: 走私，非法攜帶（槍支或毒品）

rural.eng_def: in, of, or like the countryside
rural.chi_def: 鄉村的，農村的；似鄉村的
rural.eg: The area is still very rural and undeveloped.

rush.eng_def: to (cause to) go or do something very quickly
rush.chi_def: （使）急速行進；（使）趕緊；（使）倉促行事；（使）急速做
rush.eg: I've been rushing (about/around) all day trying to get everything done.

rush.eng_def: If a group of people rush an enemy or the place where an enemy is, they attack suddenly and all together.
rush.chi_def: 一起向…發起突襲；猛攻；向…猛衝
rush.eg: We rushed the palace gates and killed the guards.

rush.eng_def: In American football, to rush is to carry the ball forward across the place on the field where play begins. Also, a member of the opposite team rushes when they force their way to the back of the field quickly to catch the player carrying the ball.
a situation in which you have to hurry or move somewhere quickly
a time when a lot of things are happening or a lot of people are trying to do or get something
rush.eg: There's always a rush to get the best seats.

rush.eng_def: the act of suddenly moving somewhere quickly
rush.eg: There was a rush of air as she opened the door.

rush.eng_def: a sudden movement of people to a certain area, usually because of some economic advantage
rush.chi_def: （通常因經濟利益驅動而發生的）蜂擁前往，蜂擁的人潮

rush.eng_def: in American football, an attempt to run forwards carrying the ball, or an attempt to quickly reach and stop a player from the opposing team who is carrying the ball
a sudden strong emotion or physical feeling
rush.chi_def: （突然的）一陣強烈感情；（身體的）一陣感覺
rush.eg: The memory of who he was came back to him with a rush.

rush.eng_def: a plant like grass that grows in or near water and whose long, thin, hollow stems can be dried and made into floor coverings, containers, etc.

rust.eng_def: a reddish-brown substance that forms on the surface of iron and steel as a result of reacting with air and water
a reddish-brown colour that looks like rust
any of various plant diseases that cause reddish-brown spots
to become or cause something to become covered with rust
rust.eg: Older cars will begin to rust.

rustle.eng_def: If things such as paper or leaves rustle, or if you rustle them, they move about and make a soft, dry sound.
rustle.chi_def: 使（紙或樹葉等）沙沙作響，使發出輕輕的摩擦聲；使沙沙作響地移動
rustle.eg: The leaves rustled in the breeze.

rustle.eng_def: the sound made by the movement of things such as leaves or paper

rusty.eng_def: If a skill you had is rusty, it is not as good as it was because you have not practised it.
rusty.eg: My Italian is a bit rusty these days.

sack.eng_def: a large bag made of strong cloth, paper, or plastic, used to store large amounts of something
sack.chi_def: 大布袋；麻袋；大紙袋；大塑膠袋
sack.eg: The corn was stored in large sacks.

sack.eng_def: a paper or plastic bag used to carry things, especially things bought in a food shop
a situation in which someone is removed from their job
sack.eg: They gave him the sack for being late.

sack.eng_def: an attack on a building or town in which a lot of destruction is caused and many valuable things are stolen
sack.eg: The sack of Rome by the Visigoths occurred in the fifth century.

sack.eng_def: in American football, an attack on the quarterback that prevents him from throwing the ball
sack.eg: The Colts have allowed only six sacks this season.
It's late - I'm going to hit the sack (= go to bed).

sack.eng_def: If someone is good/bad in the sack, they are sexually skilled/not sexually skilled.
to remove someone from a job, usually because they have done something wrong or badly, or sometimes as a way of saving the cost of employing them
sack.eg: They sacked her for being late.

sack.eng_def: in American football, to attack the quarterback in order to prevent him from throwing the ball
sack.eg: The quarterback was sacked only once and completed 16 out of 23 passes.

sack.eng_def: to attack a building or town, causing a lot of destruction and stealing many valuable things
sack.eg: The invaders sacked every village they passed on their route.

sacred.eng_def: considered to be holy and deserving respect, especially because of a connection with a god
sacred.chi_def: （尤指因與神有關而）神聖的，值得崇敬的
與宗教有關的，宗教性的

sacred.eng_def: considered too important to be changed
sacred.chi_def: 不容改變的，不可侵犯的
sacred.eg: His daily routine is absolutely sacred to him.

sacrifice.eng_def: to give up something that is valuable to you in order to help another person
sacrifice.eg: Many women sacrifice interesting careers for their families.

sacrifice.eng_def: to kill an animal or a person and offer them to a god or gods
sacrifice.chi_def: 獻祭；以（人或動物）爲祭品

sacrifice.eng_def: the act of giving up something that is valuable to you in order to help someone else
sacrifice.eg: We had to make sacrifices in order to pay for our children's education.

sacrifice.eng_def: the act of killing an animal or person and offering them to a god or gods, or the animal, etc. that is offered
sacrifice.eg: The people offered a lamb on the altar as a sacrifice for their sins.

sad.chi_def: 傷心的，悲哀的；令人難過的，令人遺憾的
sad.eg: I've just received some very sad news.

sad.eng_def: If something looks sad, it looks worse than it should because it is not being cared for.
sad.eg: Give those flowers some water - they're looking a little sad.

sad.chi_def: 令人遺憾的；令人不快的
sad.eg: The sad fact/truth is we can't afford to provide homes for all.

sad.eng_def: something you say when you are telling someone about something bad that happened
sad.eg: Sad to say, the ring was never found.

sad.eng_def: showing that you are not fashionable or interesting or have no friends
sad.chi_def: 無趣的；乏味的；不受歡迎的
sad.eg: You enjoy reading timetables? You sad man!

sad.eng_def: abbreviation for seasonal affective disorder: a medical condition in which a person does not have much energy and enthusiasm during the winter because of the reduced period of natural light
sad.chi_def: 季節性不適（冬季因日照時間縮短而引發的精力不濟，seasonal affective disorder的縮寫）

saddle.eng_def: a seat, often made of leather, used on a horse, bicycle, motorcycle, etc.
saddle.chi_def: 馬鞍；（腳踏車、機車等的）座墊，鞍座
saddle.eg: He swung himself into the saddle and rode off.
The chairman is back in the saddle after his heart attack.

saddle.eng_def: a large piece of meat taken from the middle of the back of an animal
to put a saddle on a horse
saddle.eg: She saddled (up) the horse for her friend.

safe.eng_def: not in danger or likely to be harmed
safe.eg: In some cities you don't feel safe going out alone at night.
She said that all the hostages were safe.

safe.eng_def: completely safe and without injury or damage
safe.eg: After three days lost in the mountains, all the climbers arrived home safe and sound.

safe.eng_def: not dangerous or likely to cause harm
safe.chi_def: 不會造成危險的；可靠的
safe.eg: a safe play area for children

safe.eng_def: (of a place) where something is not likely to be lost or stolen
safe.eg: Keep your passport in a safe place.

safe.eng_def: used to refer to things that do not involve any risk
safe.eg: I think we should go for the safest option (= the one that involves the least risks).

safe.eng_def: If an official elected position in is safe, it is likely to be won by the political party that has won it at previous elections.
a strong box or cupboard with special locks where valuable things, especially money or jewels (= precious stones), are kept
safe.eg: Thieves broke into/cracked (= opened by force) the safe and stole everything in it.

safeguard.eg: The union safeguards the interests of all its members.

safety.eng_def: a state in which or a place where you are safe and not in danger or at risk
safety.eg: For your (comfort and) safety, we recommend you keep your seat belt loosely fastened during the flight.

sail.eng_def: When a boat or a ship sails, it travels on the water.
sail.eg: The boat sailed along/down the coast.

sail.eng_def: to control a boat that has no engine and is pushed by the wind
sail.eg: He sailed the dinghy up the river.

sail.eng_def: When a ship sails, it starts travelling, and when people sail from a particular place or at a particular time, they start travelling in a ship.
sail.eg: Their ship sails for Bombay next Friday.

sail.eng_def: to move quickly, easily, and (of a person) confidently
sail.chi_def: 輕快地移動；（人）自信地行走
sail.eg: The ball went sailing over the fence.

sail.eng_def: a sheet of material attached to a pole on a boat to catch the wind and make the boat move
On a windmill, a sail is any of the wide blades that are turned by the wind in order to produce power.
a journey by boat or ship
sail.eg: It's two days' sail/It's a two-day sail (= a journey of two days by sea) from here to the nearest island.

sailor.eng_def: a person who works on a ship, especially one who is not an officer
a person who often takes part in the sport of using boats with sails
someone who is not/often ill when travelling by boat

saint.eng_def: (the title given to) a person who has received an official honour from the Christian, especially the Roman Catholic, Church for having lived in a good and holy way. The names of saints are sometimes used to name places and buildings
saint.chi_def: （基督教教會，尤指天主教教會正式追封的）聖徒，聖者；聖徒頭銜（聖徒的名字有時用作地名或建築物的名稱）
聖人般的人，至善的人，道德高尚的人
saint.eg: She must be a real saint to stay with him all these years.

sake.eng_def: in order to help or bring advantage to someone
sake.chi_def: 爲了（某人）的利益；爲了幫助（某人）
sake.eg: Please do it, for David's sake.

sake.eng_def: because of, or for the purpose of something
sake.eg: Let's not disagree for the sake of (= because of) a few dollars.

sake.eng_def: used to emphasize requests or orders when you are angry or have lost patience
sake.chi_def: 做做好事吧，看在上帝份上，看在老天份上
sake.eg: For goodness' sake don't let her know I told you!

sake.eng_def: a Japanese alcoholic drink made from rice and usually drunk warm

salad.eng_def: a mixture of uncooked vegetables, usually including lettuce, eaten either as a separate dish or with other food
salad.chi_def: （通常用生菜等做成的）蔬菜沙拉
salad.eg: Toss (= mix) the salad with a vinaigrette dressing.

salad.eng_def: cooked or uncooked vegetables cut into very small pieces and often mixed with mayonnaise
salad.chi_def: （用小塊生蔬菜或熟蔬菜拌上蛋黃醬做成的）蛋黃醬拌沙拉

salad.eng_def: a salad made with tuna, cheese, egg, etc. and lettuce or other cold ingredients
salad.eg: She had a tuna salad for lunch.

salad.eng_def: tuna, cheese, egg, etc. mixed with mayonnaise, used to make a sandwich
salad.chi_def: （將金槍魚／乳酪／雞蛋等拌上蛋黃醬做三明治時用）
salad.eg: I'll have egg salad on brown (bread), please.

salary.eng_def: a fixed amount of money agreed every year as pay for an employee, usually paid directly into his or her bank account every month

sale.eng_def: an act of exchanging something for money
sale.eg: The sale of cigarettes/alcohol is forbidden.

sale.eng_def: the department of a company that organizes and does the selling of the company's products or services
sale.chi_def: （公司的）銷售部門； 門市部

sale.eg: Sales this year exceeded the total for the two previous years.

sale.eng_def: an occasion when things are sold in order to make money
sale.chi_def: （為籌集資金而進行的）銷售活動，義賣活動

sale.eng_def: available to buy in a shop
sale.eg: On sale at record stores now.

sale.eng_def: a system by which goods are supplied to shopsand can be returned if they are not sold within a particular period of time
sale.eg: We can supply goods on a sale or return basis.

sale.eng_def: an occasion when goods are sold at a lower price than usual

sale.eg: Can you tell me if this dress is in the sale?

salesman.eng_def: a man whose job is selling things in a shop or directly to customers

salesperson.eng_def: a person whose job is selling things in a shop or directly to customers
